title: Virtual Assistant ‚Äì Operations & Office Manager
description:
About Us



Boiler Medic is a busy UK-based plumbing and heating company providing boiler servicing, repairs, landlord gas safety certificates and maintenance for agents, landlords and homeowners. We are growing quickly and now require a high-calibre Virtual Assistant to manage the day-to-day office operations.



This is not a basic admin role. You will be responsible for running the office, answering calls, booking and allocating jobs, speaking with customers and engineers, and chasing payments. You will be the first point of contact for the business, so excellent spoken English is absolutely essential.



The Role



You will be fully responsible for:



Answering incoming phone calls from UK customers



Booking in jobs and allocating work to engineers



Managing daily schedules and engineer diaries



Speaking confidently with customers, tenants, landlords and estate agents



Chasing outstanding payments and overdue invoices



Handling
s, WhatsApp messages and customer enquiries



Following up on quotes, no-access jobs and cancellations



Updating CRM / job management systems accurately



Resolving customer issues calmly and professionally



This is a busy, high-responsibility role and requires someone who can think, prioritise and take ownership.



ESSENTIAL Requirements ‚Äì Please Do Not Apply If You Do Not Meet These



This is very important. Please only apply if you meet all of the below:



Fluent, clear English 



Very confident speaking on the phone with customers



Experience chasing payments / debtors in a professional manner



Strong customer service skills ‚Äì polite, calm and professional



Excellent organisation and attention to detail



Reliable internet connection and quiet home working environment



Available to work UK business hours



If you are not confident on the phone, struggle with English, or have only done basic admin/data entry roles, this role is not suitable.



Highly Desirable (Strong Advantage)



Experience working with UK companies



Background in plumbing, HVAC, property management or maintenance



Experience dealing with landlords, agents and tenants



Experience using job management or CRM systems



What We Are Looking For



We want someone who is:



Confident, proactive and takes ownership



Comfortable speaking to customers all day



Able to manage multiple engineers and busy schedules



Not afraid to chase payments and follow up firmly but politely



Reliable and looking for a long-term role



This role can grow into a senior operations position for the right person.



How to Apply ‚Äì Very Important



To be considered, you must include:



A short video introduction in English (1‚Äì3 minutes) introducing yourself and explaining your experience



Confirmation of your experience with job allocation / scheduling / dispatch



Confirmation of your experience speaking to customers on the phone



Confirmation of your experience chasing payments or handling invoices



Applications without a video introduction will be automatically rejected.

title: Ecommerce Operations Manager ‚Äì Take Over & Improve Founder-Led Shopify Operations
description:
We operate and scale fashion ecommerce dropshipping brands on Shopify, promoted organically on TikTok.



One of our brands has built a strong Trustpilot reputation and a loyal base of returning customers. We are growing steadily and plan to launch additional stores this year.



The founder is currently managing core operational systems, and we are now looking for an Ecommerce Operations Manager who can take over these systems and improve them progressively.



This is a hands-on ownership role inside a growing ecommerce business.



You will not be starting from zero ‚Äî you will be taking over existing systems and making them stronger over time.



ABOUT THE ROLE



You will take over the day-to-day operational systems currently managed by the founder and improve them step by step.



This is not a beginner VA role, and it is not a corporate executive role either.

It is a hands-on ownership role inside a growing ecommerce business.



Your responsibilities include:



-Managing communication and coordination with multiple Chinese suppliers

-Ensuring orders are fulfilled correctly and on time

-Preventing wrong fulfillment and reducing operational mistakes

-Tracking and improving dispute handling and refund decisions

-Overseeing Trustpilot reputation management

-Supervising and improving the work of our Customer Support VA

-Maintaining operational trackers and reports

-Improving SOPs gradually as the business grows

-Identifying small system improvements that reduce errors and increase efficiency



You are not expected to rebuild everything immediately.

You are expected to understand the current systems, take ownership, and improve them progressively.



This role requires structure, accountability, and a long-term mindset.



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR



-Someone with Shopify ecommerce experience

-Someone who has handled suppliers or fulfillment before

-Someone who has dealt with disputes or refunds

-Someone who has supervised at least one tea
mber (even a small team)

-Someone organized, calm, and analytical

-Someone ambitious and ready to grow with the company



You do not need to have managed large teams or complex enterprise systems.



WHAT WE OFFER



-Hourly rate: 8 USD/hour 

-Full-time, long-term role

-Direct collaboration with the founder

-Opportunity to grow into a larger operations leadership role as we expand



We value consistency, ownership, and long-term collaboration.



HOW TO APPLY (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY)



To apply, please follow these steps:



1) Change your application subject to:



‚ÄúI want to take ownership of your operations Z‚Äù



2) Short Written Introduction (4‚Äì6 sentences)



Briefly explain:



-Your relevant ecommerce experience

-The approximate monthly revenue of the store you were most recently responsible for

-One operational responsibility you personally owned



3) Send your CV



4) Send a Loom video (3‚Äì5 minutes)



In your Loom, please answer the following:



1. Brief Background (1 minute)

-What type of ecommerce store have you worked on?

-What was the approximate monthly revenue?

-What were you personally responsible for?



2. Operational Thinking Scenario

Imagine you manage 3 suppliers fulfilling different SKUs.

Sometimes orders are fulfilled by the wrong supplier or delayed.

How would you structure a simple system to reduce these mistakes over time?



(We are not looking for a perfect answer. We want to understand how you think.)



3. Ownership Example

Describe one operational problem you personally fixed.

-What was happening?

-What did you change?

-What improved?



4. Growth & Responsibility

Why are you interested in taking more ownership instead of staying in a purely execution role?



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: NO EXPERIENCE? NO PROBLEM! - Account Creator
description:

If you already know you are not happy with the pay, schedule, monitoring requirements, or long-term commitment, do not apply. We are only interested in people who are confident this role is right for them from the beginning. Do not waste your time or ours.

title: WordPress Web Designer
description:
The Project

We are looking for a skilled WordPress Designer to lead a comprehensive redesign of an existing holiday farm website: 
.



The goal is to transform the current site into a modern, high-converting digital presence that attracts more guests and simplifies the booking/inquiry process.



Key Objectives

Design Refresh: Create a premium, welcoming, and modern aesthetic that reflects the charm of the holiday farm.



Conversion Focused: The layout must be optimized to generate more inquiries and leads quickly.



Mobile-First: The site must be 100% responsive and perform flawlessly on all mobile devices.



Ease of Use: You must use a popular WordPress Page Builder (e.g., Elementor, Divi, Bricks). The backend must be set up so the client can easily edit text, images, and prices themselves without needing to code.



Your Requirements

Proven Experience: You have a track record of successfully redesigning WordPress websites.



Portfolio: You can provide high-quality examples of previous WordPress sites you have built (please include links).



Strategic Thinking: You understand how design choices influence user behavior and lead generation.



Communication: You are available for an initial briefing call to discuss the project details.



The Process

Application: Submit your portfolio and a brief summary of your WordPress experience.



Initial Interview: We will hold a short call to show you the specific requirements and the scope of the new site.



The Quote: After the call, you will be asked to provide a fixed-price offer for the "ready-to-go" website.



How to Apply

Please send us your resume and, most importantly, links to at least 3-5 WordPress websites you have designed or redesigned.



Direct Quote Required:

Before applying, please visit and review the current website: 
. We require you to include a price range (from - to) in USD ($) directly in your application for the full redesign and "ready-to-go" delivery of this project.



Applications without a portfolio and a price range in USD will not be considered.

You will assist with operational and administrative tasks, ensuring smooth coordination with suppliers and internal teams. title: Google Sheets & Dashboard Expert
description:
This role manages the backend technical operations of the supply chain ‚Äî ensuring that inventory, pricing, SKU data, workflows, and dashboards are clean, current, and actionable. The person in this position will be responsible for building and maintaining dynamic, multi-layered dashboards in Google Sheets, supporting operational decisions through data accuracy and structured reporting.



Responsibilities:



‚Ä¢ Build, manage, and continuously optimize live dashboards in Google Sheets to monitor stock levels, inventory movements, purchasing trends, and data integrity.

‚Ä¢ Design structured reporting templates and tools to ensure clarity, consistency, and actionable insights across the supply chain.

‚Ä¢ Maintain and optimize the master product list in Google Sheets, including SKUs, supplier information, cost/pricing structures, and product lifecycle updates.

‚Ä¢ Conduct regular audits and reconciliations between Google Sheets, CIN7, and other systems to ensure data accuracy and alignment.

‚Ä¢ Track inventory movements across platforms, identify discrepancies, and perform corrective data audits.

‚Ä¢ Provide purchasing, sales, and finance teams with accurate, dashboard-driven insights to support decision-making.

‚Ä¢ Manage and improve ClickUp task workflows, templates, and project boards related to operations and supply chain reporting.

‚Ä¢ Ensure that all project deadlines and dependencies are reflected accurately in ClickUp.

‚Ä¢ Support the creation and continuous improvement of SOPs for dashboard reporting, inventory data management, and system integrations.





Qualifications:



‚Ä¢ Minimum 2 years of experience in inventory/data operations or a supply chain analyst role.

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Google Sheets, including QUERY, VLOOKUP, pivot tables, and error-checking.

‚Ä¢ Experience with Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools.

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in building and maintaining structured, multi-tab dashboards for operational and executive use.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of inventory flow, product lifecycle stages, and cost/pricing structures.

‚Ä¢ Highly analytical with exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in data handling.

‚Ä¢ Skilled in data reconciliation and resolving discrepancies across multiple systems.

‚Ä¢ Familiar with inventory management platforms such as CIN7, DEAR, or similar tools.

‚Ä¢ Experienced in using ClickUp or equivalent tools for project tracking and workflow automation.

‚Ä¢ Able to document and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) for dashboards and data processes.

‚Ä¢ Self-motivated, reliable, and comfortable working in a fully remote, results-driven environment.

‚Ä¢ Bonus: Experience working in e-commerce, hardware, or logistics-related industries.





Essential Requirements for Remote Work:

‚Ä¢ Reliable Laptop or Desktop Computer.

‚Ä¢ Stable and high-speed internet connection.

‚Ä¢ Power source and backup internet connection in case of electricity interruptions.



***How to Apply***



Take the next step by completing our application form:


/
/f/3j1fc-35945/HQ578HNFWTW3B7LXDL



Note: Only successful candidates will be contacted for the next phase of the selection process. We appreciate your time and interest in joining our team.

title: Sales Channel Executive
description:

We are looking for a fast, organized, and proactive Sales Channels Executive to help move aging inventory through non-traditional sales channels and direct B2B outreach. This role is not about managing an online shop ‚Äî it's about using alternative platforms, tools, and communication methods to get inventory into the hands of the right buyers quickly. The role requires someone who can think creatively, act quickly, communicate clearly, and follow through with persistence.



This is a remote position, ideal for someone who is experienced in B2B sales support, platform-based listings, and high-speed communication across
 and phone.



Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Aging Inventory Movement: Take full ownership of promoting and moving aging inventory through alternative sales channels, B2B networks, and creative outreach.

‚Ä¢ B2B Lead Generation & Outreach: Identify, contact, and follow up with potential B2B buyers via
 and phone to generate sales opportunities and partnerships.

‚Ä¢ Platform Management: Post and maintain inventory on appropriate online platforms (e.g., classifieds, B2B directories, trade forums) to increase visibility and inbound inquiries.

‚Ä¢ Rapid Response Communication: Act as the first point of contact for inbound and outbound communication ‚Äî all
s and phone calls must be answered promptly, professionally, and with urgency.

‚Ä¢ Follow-up Execution: Ensure every lead or inquiry is followed up quickly and thoroughly, keeping 
ntum until a clear outcome is reached.

‚Ä¢ Tracking & Coordination: Maintain accurate logs of communication, inventory postings, outreach status, and buyer pipelines in shared trackers or CRM tools.

‚Ä¢ Cross-Team Collaboration: Coordinate with internal sales and operations teams to ensure availability, pricing, and delivery readiness are aligned with sales efforts.

‚Ä¢ Experience in B2B sales, inventory coordination, or sales support ‚Äî especially in managing unsold or aging stock.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills ‚Äî written and verbal ‚Äî with a focus on speed, clarity, and persuasiveness.

title: Junior Virtual Assistant / Business Operations Assistant
description:
*** Please read through the entire post before applying.  Thanks! ***



Company Description

Engage Video Production (EVP) creates educational and communication focused video content, primarily for aerospace, defense, and technical clients. Our work helps high stakes organizations explain complex ideas clearly, train teams effectively, and communicate with absolute precision. We operate with a military grade standard of excellence and are looking for a Junior Business Operations Assistant who is ready to grow within a high accountability environment.



The Three Pillars of Success at EVP

To succeed here, you must embody these three core values:



Discipline: You follow through on every task without "floundering" or ghosting. You possess the self-discipline to manage your time and meet deadlines without constant supervision.



Motivation and Dedication: You are dedicated to the mission and the company's growth. You don't just "do a job"; you look for ways to contribute to the overall success of the team.



Radical Integrity and Accountability: You own your mistakes immediately. You have the backbone to point out errors for correction, even if they are your own, because you understand that precision is non-negotiable.



*** Role Overview *** 

This is a "Junior Plus" role designed for someone who is not completely green but is looking to move toward a high level lead position. We invest in people who show discipline, but we have zero tolerance for lack of communication.



*** Core Responsibilities *** 

Data Management: Update and maintain Google Sheets with project tracking data.



Social Media Support: Basic scheduling and engagement via Meta Business Suite and LinkedIn.

s.

description:
Role summary



We manage multiple
 channels across the full funnel. We‚Äôre looking for a
 Marketing Manager who executes daily: posting, scheduling, time-sensitive updates, and performance iteration. This is not a ‚Äúcreative content‚Äù job ‚Äî this is operator work with clear KPIs.



You‚Äôll work closely with our copywriter and use existing assets (proof, results, testimonials) while adapting fast to new flows and campaigns.



What you will do (daily)



Create, schedule, and post
 content across multiple channels (every day)

Your
/community experience (what channels, what results)

ntum post (FOMO without hype spam)

 style): risk management + trading psychology

title: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant

Reports To:  CEO

Work Hours:  Philippines daytime work hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field.  We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact.  You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.  

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides.  Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products.  We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

That‚Äôs where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

Own, track, and optimize every cost that impacts Amazon unit economics, so leadership always has a clear, accurate, and optimized view of true ASIN-level profitability.



What Success Looks Like:

Success in this role means true Amazon profitability is no longer a guessing game. Every ASIN has a fully loaded cost that includes product cost, shipping, duties, Amazon fees, affiliate commissions, and ranking-related marketing spend. Leadership can confidently d
 which products to scale, reprice, suppress, liquidate, or discontinue based on real data ‚Äî not blended averages or assumptions.



A top performer in this role consistently reduces total Amazon unit costs while improving cost visibility. Through tight auditing, proactive fee recovery, smarter shipping and duty tracking, and disciplined attribution of affiliate and ranking spend, this role directly increases contribution margin without increasing ad spend or revenue risk.



Primary Objectives

‚Ä¢  Amazon Fee, Shipping & Cost Auditing

Own end-to-end auditing of all Amazon, logistics, and ranking-related costs.

‚Ä¢  Fully Loaded ASIN-Level Unit Economics

Maintain accurate per-unit costs including shipping, duties, fees, affiliates, and marketing.

‚Ä¢  Cost Optimization & Reduction

Identify and implement cost-saving opportunities across fees, logistics, and promotional spend.

‚Ä¢  Profitability & Decision Support

Provide leadership with clean, reliable Amazon cost and margin reporting.  



Regular Work Activities

‚Ä¢  Audit all Amazon FBA fees (pick/pack, weight, storage, returns)

‚Ä¢  Track short-term and long-term storage fees by ASIN

‚Ä¢  Monitor aged inventory fees and cost exposure

‚Ä¢  Track AWD inbound, storage, and handling fees

‚Ä¢  Reconcile inbound placement fees

‚Ä¢  Track removal, disposal, and liquidation costs

‚Ä¢  Track international shipping costs (factory ? port ? Amazon)

‚Ä¢  Allocate shipping cost per unit by shipment and ASIN

‚Ä¢  Track duties, tariffs, customs, and brokerage fees

‚Ä¢  Maintain landed cost per unit calculations

‚Ä¢  Track affiliate commissions tied to Amazon sales

‚Ä¢  Attribute affiliate spend at ASIN or product-group level

‚Ä¢  Track ranking, launch, and promotional marketing costs

‚Ä¢  Identify unprofitable or fee-heavy SKUs

‚Ä¢  Submit and track Amazon reimbursement claims

‚Ä¢  Create monthly Amazon cost & margin reports

‚Ä¢  Monitor fee and cost trend anomalies

‚Ä¢  Maintain SOPs for Amazon cost tracking and audits



Key Skills Required

‚Ä¢  Understanding & ability to learn Amazon FBA fee structures

‚Ä¢  Strong grasp of landed cost accounting

‚Ä¢  Advanced spreadsheet skills

‚Ä¢  Experience with SKU-level profitability modeling

‚Ä¢  Strong analytical and investigative mindset

‚Ä¢  High attention to detail

‚Ä¢  Ability to reconcile complex datasets

‚Ä¢  Process-driven 

‚Ä¢  Cost-reduction oriented thinking

‚Ä¢  Clear written & verbal communication



People Contacts and Interactions ‚Äì What are the primary people contacts in this job (who, why, and how often)?

‚Ä¢  Direct report to the CEO

‚Ä¢  Frequent communication with

‚Ä¢ Operations Team

‚Ä¢ Logistics Team



Role Requirements

Experience, Training, and Education 

‚Ä¢  2+ years working with Amazon Seller Central data

‚Ä¢  Experience tracking shipping, duties, and landed costs

‚Ä¢  Familiarity with FBA, AWD, and storage fee structures

‚Ä¢  Advanced spreadsheet proficiency required

‚Ä¢  E-commerce or marketplace finance experience preferred

‚Ä¢  Experience submitting Amazon reimbursement claims preferred

‚Ä¢  Comfortable owning ASIN-level economics end-to-end

‚Ä¢  Strong personal accountability

‚Ä¢  Not responsible for tax, payroll, AR/AP, or general bookkeeping     



How to Apply:

Click the link - 

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Shopify E-commerce Operator (Founder‚Äôs Right Hand)
description:
We are building a fast-growing U.S. e-commerce brand and we are looking for a serious, experienced Shopify operator to become the founder‚Äôs right hand. You need to be a REAL LEADER and problem solver. 



This is NOT a beginner VA position.

This is for someone who has actually managed and operated Shopify stores.



Role Overview



You will be responsible for day-to-day operations inside our Shopify ecosystem, including:



- Product listings (variants, metafields, mockups, descriptions)

- Printify product setup + syncing

- Order management & fulfillment checks

- Customer support handling 
 based)

- Refunds / returns / tracking issues

- App setup & optimization

- Basic theme edits (sections, layout adjustments)

- Uploading ad creatives & organizing assets

- Supplier communication when needed

- Helping improve systems & processes



You must think in systems, not tasks.



This Job Is For You If: (Min. 3+ years experience as virtual assistant)



- You have managed multiple Shopify stores 

- You understand fulfillment flows end-to-end

- You have worked with Printify or POD before (Preferred, or willing to learn quickly)

- You can troubleshoot Shopify issues independently

- You are extremely organized and detail-oriented

- You don‚Äôt wait for instructions ‚Äî you take ownership

- You know how to hire and build a team

- You are calm under pressure

- You are a quick learner and a real leader



Do NOT Apply If:

- You‚Äôve only ‚Äúassisted‚Äù but never operated a store

- You need constant supervision

- You disappear or go offline during work hours

- You are managing 3‚Äì4 other full-time clients



Work Requirements



- 48 hours per week

- Flexible schedule, but you must be consistently online and reachable

- Fast response time is critical

- Long-term position only



Compensation



$1,000 USD per month starting



Growth to $1,500 USD per month based on performance



Long-term opportunity with growth into operations leadership



Application Instructions (Important)



To apply, answer the following:



Tell us about all your skills and experience as a shopify e-commerce brand operator



What is your motivation and why are you a real A player



List the Shopify stores you have directly managed (not assisted). What was your exact responsibility?



Explain how Printify fulfillment works step-by-step.



Confirm you are available at least 48 hours per week and not working full-time for another client.



Start your application with the word: OPERATOR



Applications without these answers will be ignored.

title: Google Workspace Expert
description:
We‚Äôre Hiring a Google Workspace Expert!



We are seeking a technically strong Google Workspace Expert to lead a structured migration, configuration, and security hardening of our Google Workspace environment.



We are not looking for basic setup support ‚Äî we‚Äôre looking for someone who understands infrastructure,
 authentication, and scalable Workspace architecture.



This role is project-based and remote, with a defined scope and clear deliverables.



About Us



Best Life is a fast-growing e-commerce company specializing in ergonomic sleep and comfort products. Our operations rely heavily on
 reliability, structured Drive access, and secure user management. We are optimizing our internal systems to support long-term scalability and international operations.



What You‚Äôll Do & What We‚Äôre Looking For



Job Responsibilities and Tasks:



- Plan and execute a structured Google Workspace migration (users, mailboxes, domains, aliases, shared inboxes,).

- Configure Gmail, Drive, Admin Console, Groups, and Organizational Units properly.

- Set up and validate domain authentication (MX, SPF, DKIM, DMARC).

- Implement security best practices (2FA enforcement, role-based admin access, permission structuring).

- Integrate Workspace with third-party tools and automate workflows where possible.

- Configure and support Gemini and AI-driven workflows within Workspace.

- Provide documentation and basic SOPs so our team can operate confidently.

- Ensure the Workspace environment is stable, secure, and ready for scaling.



Skills and Qualifications:



- Proven experience with Google Workspace migrations and configuration.

- Strong understanding of DNS, MX, SPF, DKIM, and domain verification.

- Experience working with hosting providers (e.g., Vimexx or similar).

- Experience with Gemini for Google Workspace and implementing AI-assisted workflows, including automation, documentation systems, and
 process optimization.

- Ability to explain technical topics clearly to non-technical tea
mbers.

- Proactive problem-solver who takes ownership and works independently.



Salary:



- Open to proposal - the project can be priced in phases (1: setup & migration, 2: SOPs & optimization, 3: Gemini and custom GPT training), with a clear rate and timeline per phase.



Screening Questions: To be considered, please answer the following clearly and specifically.  Please note that generic responses will not be considered. Kindly answer based on real implementation experience and include supporting screenshots or proof of past work (sensitive information may be blurred).



1. Describe a recent Google Workspace migration you completed.

    - Company size?

    - Migration complexity?

    - What challenges did you face and how did you solve them?

2. Have you worked with DNS providers like Vimexx, GoDaddy, Cloudflare, or similar?

    - Which ones?

    - Describe a propagation or DNS conflict issue you resolved.

3. What would your structured migration plan look like for a 10-15 user company?  Outline your phases briefly.

4. Have you implemented Gemini or AI tools within Google Workspace?

    - Describe a real workflow you built.

    - What problem did it solve?

title: WordPress Content & Operations VA ‚Äî Health/Wellness Website (Long-Term, Part-Time)
description:
## About The Project



I run a research-based health website focused on kidney disease and anti-aging interventions ‚Äî 
. The site is built around a published book covering 68 scientifically-validated natural therapies, supported by a blog with articles grounded in medical research (PubMed, nephrology journals, etc.).

I'm a full-time professional based in Sydney, Australia, with limited availability. I need someone who can own the operational side of this website completely ‚Äî not someone who waits for instructions on every small task.

This is a long-term role. If you're good and the site grows (which is the plan), your hours and pay grow with it.



What You'll Be Doing

In the first 30 days, your priorities will be:



Installing and configuring WordPress plugins (Google Analytics 4 via Site Kit, Search Console, RankMath SEO, ConvertKit, Pretty Links, Hotjar, UpdraftPlus)

Setting up
 opt-in forms and a welcome
 sequence in ConvertKit/MailerLite

Auditing all existing blog articles against a Google EEAT compliance checklist I'll provide

Revising articles using Claude AI (I'll give you a prompt template) to improve citations, author authority signals, and trustworthiness markers

Setting up affiliate links for health supplements (iHerb, Amazon Associates) using Pretty Links



After the first month, your ongoing responsibilities will include:



Publishing 2-3 SEO-optimised blog articles per week (you research and write drafts; I review and approve)

Building and managing a monthly keyword content calendar using Ubersuggest or similar

Managing
 broadcasts and the monthly community newsletter draft

Monitoring GA4 and Search Console and sending me a brief weekly summary (what's ranking, what's growing, what needs attention)

Maintaining affiliate link accuracy and adding new affiliate opportunities as they arise

Light Canva work for blog images and product mockups





You're The Right Person If:



You have at least 2 years of hands-on WordPress experience (not just "I've used it" ‚Äî you know plugins, themes, settings, and can troubleshoot basic issues without Googling for 3 hours)

You have done SEO content work before and understand what keyword research, meta descriptions, and internal linking actually mean in practice

You're comfortable using AI tools like Claude or ChatGPT to assist with content drafting and revision ‚Äî you don't need to be an expert, but you can't be afraid of it

You have worked on a health, wellness, or medical-adjacent website before (not required, but a significant advantage)

You can work with minimal supervision ‚Äî I'll give you clear deliverables and deadlines, but I won't micromanage daily tasks

You're based in the Philippines and available for a short weekly check-in call (30 min, Sydney time ‚Äî flexible on exact timing)

Your written English is excellent. Health content requires precision ‚Äî vague or sloppy writing won't work here





You're NOT The Right Person If:



You need constant hand-holding or daily check-ins to stay on track

You've never managed affiliate links or worked with monetised content before

You apply to every job on this platform without reading the post (see application instructions below)

You're looking for short-term or project-only work



Hours & Compensation



Start: 20 hours/week

Rate: $5 USD/hour depending on experience (open to negotiation for the right candidate)

Paid weekly via Wise or Payoneer

Hours can increase to 30-40/week within 3-6 months as the project scales



Tools You'll Be Using

WordPress, RankMath, ConvertKit or MailerLite, Pretty Links, Google Analytics 4, Google Search Console, Ubersuggest, Canva, Claude AI, Gumroad, Google Docs/Sheets, Notion (for task tracking)



How To Apply

To filter serious applicants: begin your application message with the phrase "Kidney Health VA" followed by your answer to this question:

"Describe one specific thing you would check or fix on a health blog article to improve its Google EEAT score. Be specific ‚Äî not general."

Then include:



A brief overview of your most relevant experience (2-3 paragraphs)

Links to any WordPress sites you've worked on (even if you just managed them ‚Äî I'm not looking for designers)

Your availability and timezone

Your motivation (or story) for the role



Applications that don't follow these instructions will not be read. This isn't being harsh ‚Äî it's how I know you pay attention to detail, which is the most important quality for this role.



One More Thing

This website is about a topic that matters ‚Äî helping people with serious kidney disease find affordable, evidence-based options outside the standard clinical pathway. I want someone who finds that work meaningful, not just someone filling hours. If that resonates with you, I'd love to hear from you. If anyone of your family or friends is suffering from chronic diseases, and if you are going deep into clinical research to help him or her, include that in the "Your motivation (or story) for the role" section.



NOTE: Applications must be handwritten ‚Äî AI-generated responses will be filtered out. The role itself heavily involves AI tools including Claude, so comfort with AI is required

title: Senior Shopify eCommerce Manager
description:
We operate a high-ticket Durable Medical Equipment (DME) store selling mobility scooters, power wheelchairs, hospital beds, and lift chairs.



This is not an entry-level VA role.



We are hiring an experienced Shopify professional who understands high-ticket eCommerce and can demonstrate measurable business impact.



Role Responsibilities



Build and optimize high-ticket product listings ($1,000‚Äì$10,000+)



Structure pages for SEO and conversion (H1/H2/H3, internal linking, specs formatting)



Improve conversion rate and AOV



Ensure technical accuracy with suppliers



Support operations and marketing when required



You may be required to overlap into other areas of the business.



Mandatory Application Requirements



Applications without ALL of the following will be deleted:



1. 3‚Äì5 Minute Video



In your video:



Explain your Shopify experience (high-ticket stores only)



Explain how you build a high-ticket product page



Quantify your results (conversion rate increases, traffic growth, ROAS improvements, AOV improvements, etc.)



If you cannot quantify results, do not apply.



Do NOT say you cannot provide evidence due to NDA. We are not asking for backend access, only measurable outcomes.



2. Written Explanation



Provide a clear breakdown of:



Your product listing process



How you structure SEO and CRO



How you validate specs and ensure accuracy



Generic answers will be rejected.



Requirements

title: International Export Sales Manager (Food & Agricultural Products)
description:
We are looking for an experienced International Export Sales Manager to handle end-to-end export of coconut oil and other coconut-based products. This role covers local supplier management in the Philippines and international sales activities focused on Europe and Israel.



You will manage sourcing, export operations, and business to business (B2B) sales while building long-term relationships with suppliers and international clients.



Must Have

- At least 5 years of experience in international export sales, or agricultural products

- Background in food ingredients, agricultural products, or edible oils

- Proven experience selling to European markets

- Hands-on experience with export logistics and documentation

- Strong understanding of Incoterms, shipping, and international trade processes

- Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken)

- Strong negotiation, pricing, and deal-closing skills

- Ability to manage multiple suppliers and clients across different time zones

- Detail-oriented, independent, and execution-focused



Responsibilities

- Source, onboard, and manage local coconut product suppliers and manufacturers

- Negotiate pricing, volumes, MOQs, contracts, and delivery schedules

- Coordinate production planning, lead times, and product availability

- Monitor product quality, specifications, and consistency

- Manage export documentation including invoices, packing lists, certificates, and related requirements

- Coordinate with freight forwarders, shipping partners, and customs brokers

- Ensure compliance with EU and Israeli food import regulations and labeling standards

- Develop and execute business to business (B2B) sales strategies for Europe and Israel

- Build and maintain a strong pipeline of importers, distributors, and manufacturers

- Conduct client meetings, sales negotiations, and contract discussions

- Track market trends, pricing, and competitive landscape

- Prepare sales forecasts and basic commercial performance reports



Plus to Have

- Experience with coconut products or tropical agricultural commodities

- Familiarity with EU food compliance or Israeli import requirements

- Knowledge of organic, non-GMO, or similar product certifications

- Existing buyer or distributor network in Europe or Israel

- Experience working with export companies or export-focused SMEs

Digital & Automation

 campaigns and nurture workflows

Brand & Market Positioning

What We‚Äôre Looking For



Experience

- Experience working with vendors, channel partners, and MDF programs



Skills

Personal Attributes

Why Join Us

title: Interior Design Assist
description:
Lead Interiors Sourcing & Procurement Coordinator



Pay: $650/month (Full-Time)

Duration: 3 Months (Intensive Phase) with potential for long-term extension.

Reports to: Studio Manager / Christina Rhodes 



The Mission

We are in the high-velocity restoration phase of a 200-year-old British Barn‚Äîa heritage project that blends British history with a "Fairytale" aesthetic. We need a visually elite, technically proficient Sourcing Coordinator to take Christina‚Äôs mood boards and floor plans and translate them into a fully costed, actionable procurement engine.



Key Responsibilities:

Visual-to-Volume Translation: Read 2D/3D floor plans and technical drawings to calculate precise quantities for heritage materials (stone, timber, fabric, hardware).



High-Velocity Sourcing: Research and find 3‚Äì5 "on-brand" options for everything from cast-iron radiators to antique brass handles within 24-48 hours of a brief.



The Canva Selection Decks: Create well visually pleasing Canva decks for Christina‚Äôs review. Each slide must include the visual, purchase link, lead time, and total cost (including shipping/VAT). 



Budget Management: Maintain the Master Procurement Tracker (Google Sheets, provided to you). You are responsible for ensuring every choice fits within our financial plan or clearly shows how over/under budget it is. 



Lead Time Guarding: We have a strict 60-day window for major decisions. You will track shipping timelines to ensure the project stays on schedule.





Requirements



Technical Skill: Must be able to read and interpret architectural floor plans/layouts.



Platform Mastery: Expert-level Canva (for decks) and Google Sheets (for tracking).



The "Eye": An innate understanding of the aesthetic. You understand the difference between modern minimalism and British heritage. 



Availability: Full-time (40 hours/week) for an initial 3-month contract. We move fast; you must be available for quick-turnaround requests during UK working hours.



Why this role?

You will be working at the heart of an iconic brand build. While this starts as a 3-month intensive project, we are building a long-term "Heritage House." For the right candidate, this is an opportunity to become a permanent pillar of the Christina Rhodes Studio, spanning interiors, events, and fashion.



To Apply

Please send the word GRANGE in the title 

Please send any visual references to work you've done or explain why you want this job 

Confirm when you can start and that you can do APPX 40/hours a week

title: Job Post: Dispute Manager for Ecom Fashion Store
description:
Hey there!



We‚Äôre looking for a Dispute Manager to join our Ecom Fashion Dropshipping Store.

We‚Äôre a fast-growing e-commerce company operating in the USA market currently processing around [insert number] orders per day.

This is a key backend position ‚Äî you‚Äôll be fully responsible for handling, managing, and winning disputes, while also preventing them from happening again.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Minimum 1 year of experience successfully handling disputes in e-commerce or fashion dropshipping.

Proven experience winning disputes and building strong evidence-based cases.

Familiar with dispute reasons such as wrong sizing, long shipping times, poor quality, and miscommunication.

Ability to collect, structure, and submit strong evidence (e.g., tracking info, customer communication, product photos).

The Order Issue Manager

The Customer Support team

The Supplier

Your Main Tasks

Manage all incoming disputes from payment processors.

Build detailed dispute cases with screenshots, tracking, communication logs, and delivery proof.

Submit cases on time and follow up until each one is resolved.

Work directly with Customer Support and Order Issue Management to fix recurring causes.

Communicate with suppliers to verify shipment and product quality details.

Track dispute statistics and keep an internal record of all cases and results.

Implement prevention strategies to reduce future disputes.



 Compensation & Bonuses

Bonus structure for each won dispute ‚Äî paid per successful case.

What We Offer

Long-term position (we‚Äôre looking for someone to stay 6+ months minimum).

A structured environment with clear SOPs and templates for dispute handling.

Communication and task management via Slack.

Collaboration with a strong, professional team.

Growth opportunities as we expand into multiple stores and markets.

After watching the video, you can respond with your thoughts ‚Äî and if it feels like a good match, we‚Äôll schedule a call to discuss the next steps.



 Important

Only apply if:

You‚Äôve read this entire post carefully.

You meet all the requirements listed above.

You‚Äôre serious about joining a long-term team that values responsibility and accuracy.

title: Sr. Web Developer-PH
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE:¬†



THIS IS A PART-TIME TO FULLTIME ROLE (will start as part-time for 60-90 days then transition to fulltime)!



We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Web Developer to join our dev team. You thrive building beautiful, high-performing websites and digital experiences for top-tier brands. RESPONSIBILITIES:¬†

lead development of WordPress using ACF, custom blocks, Twig templating, custom post types, and block-based themes, with performance, accessibility, SEO, and high-quality execution built in

build projects with headless CMS platforms like Contentful, Storyblok, or WordPress as a headless backend, leveraging REST API or GraphQL, and using frontend frameworks like Next.js or Nuxt.js with headless architectures

create pixel-perfect, fully functioning frontends using Tailwind CSS, GSAP , and other modern frontend technologies, ensuring responsive, interactive, and high-performance experiences

On day one, we'll expect you to...

be open to part-time to fulltime opportunity

be a current resident of the Philippines and legally able to perform work from there

What separates the best from the rest:



advanced GSAP/ animations experience

mentorship, client management, and cross-team collaboration experience

experience optimizing performance, accessibility, SEO, security, and DevOps at scale

Edge and CDN strategy experience for modern web projects

NOTES:



Benefits await full-time contractors.¬†

This is a remote (work from home) position.

title: Wholesale Sales and Outreach Assistant
description:
Pay: $5‚Äì7 USD/hour depending on experience



Weekly Hours: 10‚Äì15 hours per week to begin, with potential to increase as we grow together.



Schedule: Flexible, self-paced hours with some overlap in Pacific Time preferred. We ask for availability for a 1‚Äì2 hour Zoo
eting once or twice a week for team coordination and check-ins (ideally between 3 PM‚Äì6 PM PST).



Bonuses: 13th-month bonus provided annually in December, for long-term tea
mbers pro-rated based on hours worked. 



Perks: Heart-centered leadership, long-term opportunity, and clear direction



Reports to: Brand & Project Manager (Jena) and Owner (Jasmine)



Start Date: ASAP



---



Role Summary



Wild Woman Herbal Apothecary is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Wholesale Sales & Outreach Assistant to help grow our B2B presence. This role is key to building relationships with aligned retailers, managing wholesale outreach, and ensuring smooth follow-up and customer service for our wholesale clients.



If you‚Äôre highly organized, love spreadsheets, enjoy connecting with others, and are excited by the mission of helping more women connect to healing herbal remedies ‚Äî we‚Äôd love to hear from you!



We're looking for a detail-oriented, heart-centered tea
mber to support the growth of our wholesale program. You'll help build meaningful retail relationships expanding the brand‚Äôs reach and ensure smooth backend operations.



---



Key Responsibilities



1. Wholesale Lead Generation & CRM Management



- Research aligned potential stockists and wholesale accounts (boutiques, wellness stores, yoga/spa spaces, spas)

- Add prospects to CRM in Notion

- Manage outreach funnel

- Track interactions and categorize leads (outreach, follow-up, response, etc.)

- Maintain updated contact records, notes, and lead statuses



2. Outreach & Follow-Up



- Send initial outreach
s (customized templates provided)

- Track lead status and follow up consistently

- Prepare and send wholesale onboarding materials (line sheet, sample box info, etc.)

- Follow up on unopened or unanswered
s

- Send sample kit offers and thank-you follow-ups

- Schedule follow-up
s to check in or send new product info

- Develop and maintain strong relationships with retail partners, addressing their needs and concerns.

- Organize and archive feedback from stockists



3. Order & Customer Support



- Monitor wholesale orders on Faire and WooCommerce

- Send thank-you messages and review reminders

- Provide order status updates if needed

- Flag and report any order issues to the team

- Provide excellent customer service, ensuring satisfaction and repeat business.



4. Sales Reporting & Organization



- Track number of leads contacted, converted, and in progress weekly

- Provide short weekly summary with highlights and insights

- Assist with creating monthly recap reports or visuals



---



Tools You'll Use



- Notion (CRM & Task Management)

- Google Drive

- Gmail

- ClickUp

- Chat GPT

- Faire Wholesale Platform

- WhatsApp (occasional team communication)



---



Ideal Skills & Qualities



- Strong written and verbal communication and negotiation skills (especially
 correspondence).

- Friendly, organized, and self-motivated to work independently and meet sales targets.

- Experience in sales, preferably in wholesale or B2B environments.

- Ability to analyze sales data and adjust strategies accordingly.

- Experience working with Notion, Chat GPT, CRMs and tracking sales

- Organized and strong attention to detail (you triple-check your messages!)

- Bonus: Experience with the herbal or wellness industry



---



Growth Path



This role can evolve into a Wholesale Coordinator or Sales Manager, with increased responsibility in B2B strategy, client communication, and onboarding new accounts. The individual would lead a team of sales representatives, develop sales strategies, and work closely with the marketing team to drive overall revenue growth and manage future outreach tea
mbers.



---



About Us



Wild Woman Herbal Apothecary is a small, heart-led, women-owned wellness brand based in Los Angeles, CA. We craft organic, small-batch herbal products designed to support women‚Äôs wellness ‚Äî with a focus on pregnancy, hormonal balance, and emotional wellbeing.



Rooted in the values of reconnecting with nature and reclaiming inner wisdom, our mission is to help women honor the sacred cycles of their bodies and live in harmony with the rhythms of the Earth. By nurturing our relationship with ourselves and the land, we aim to inspire a collective healing that touches families, communities, and future generations.



We‚Äôre currently building a small, dedicated team of virtual assistants to help us grow sustainably while maintaining our soul-centered mission. We value kindness, clear communication, and attention to detail, and we're looking for tea
mbers who feel personally aligned with our values.



--



To apply: Please begin your application message with the phrase ‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited to support Wild Woman because‚Ä¶‚Äù and tell us why this role speaks to you and your skills. Applications without this phrase will not be reviewed.



Thank you for your time. I'm looking forward to finding the perfect tea
mber.

 ABOUT THE ROLE



We are a U.S.-based real estate investment company looking for disciplined, reliable cold callers to help us identify motivated property owners.



This role is NOT sales. You will NOT negotiate prices or explain real estate. Your only responsibility is to follow a script, ask simple questions, and pass interested property owners to our acquisitions manager.



If you can follow instructions, stay focused, and dial consistently, this job is for you.



 RESPONSIBILITIES



Make outbound calls to property owners using provided lists



Follow the approved script word-for-word



Ask basic qualifying questions (condition, timeline, motivation)



Tag calls correctly in the system



Submit warm leads immediately using a provided format



Maintain daily call volume requirements



 WHAT THIS JOB IS NOT



- No selling



- No negotiating



- No explaining contracts or prices



- No freelancing or script changes



You either follow the system or this role will not work.



? REQUIREMENTS



Excellent spoken English (neutral accent preferred)



Reliable internet connection



Quiet work environment (no background noise)



Ability to follow instructions exactly



Previous cold calling experience is a plus (but not required)



Comfortable making 400‚Äì600 dials per day



 PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS



400+ dials per day



Accurate call tagging



At least 1 warm lead per day on average



Consistent attendance and punctuality



Performance is measured by activity and quality, not excuses.



PAY & BONUSES



Hourly pay: $5‚Äì$6/hour (based on experience)



$250 bonus per closed deal that closes from your lead



Opportunity for increased hours and pay based on results



TRAINING & TRIAL PERIOD



1 hour unpaid training which is also the interview for the position



3 day paid trial period



Daily review of call activity



Long-term position available for top performers



 IDEAL CANDIDATE



You are:



Detail-oriented



Comfortable with repetitive tasks



Emotionally calm when people say no or are hateful



Focused on results, not talking



 HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



When applying, please answer the following:



Do you have experience with cold calling? If yes, explain briefly.



Are you comfortable making 400‚Äì600 calls per day?



What is your internet speed?



What hours are you available to work daily?



Record a 15‚Äì25 second voice sample reading this exact script (no changes):



‚ÄúHi, is this the owner of the property at 123 Main Street? I‚Äôm calling because we‚Äôre looking to buy a house in that area. Would you consider selling if the price made sense?‚Äù



Recording rules: quiet room, clear audio, normal speed, one take (no heavy editing).



Applications without answers to these questions AND the exact voice sample will NOT be reviewed.



We are hiring immediately.



If you are reliable, focused, and can follow a system, this is a lucrative long-term opportunity.

title: Performance Creative Strategist & Editor
description:
We are currently looking for a highly skilled **E-Commerce Video Editor** who understands performance marketing and knows how to create efficient, creative, and high-converting videos for online stores. This is not a basic editing role ‚Äî we are searching for someone who understands hooks, retention, buyer psychology, and direct response structures. Your work should not only look good, but drive measurable results.



You will be responsible for turning raw footage (UGC, product shots, testimonials) into scroll-stopping ads for Meta, TikTok, and YouTube. The ideal candidate understands how to grab attention within the first 1‚Äì3 seconds, structure ads for maximum watch time, and optimize creatives based on performance data. We are building and scaling multiple fast-growing E-Commerce brands, and we are looking for a long-term partner who wants to grow with us.



**What we expect:**



* Proven experience editing high-converting E-Commerce ads

* Strong understanding of direct response and performance marketing

* Ability to create powerful hooks and dynamic pacing

* Experience with UGC-style creatives

* Clean, modern editing style with strong captions & sound design

* Fast turnaround times and structured workflow

* Ability to iterate based on data and feedback

* Proactive mindset ‚Äî bringing ideas, not just execution



Compensation is competitive and performance-based. We reward strong creatives and high-performing editors with long-term opportunities and attractive upside potential.



If you believe you can create ads that convert ‚Äî not just videos that look good ‚Äî we would love to see your portfolio and best-performing work.

title: CPA Accountant
description:
We are seeking a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) to join our organisation under an exclusive arrangement. Please note that this position is not open to freelancers, contractors, or companies.

 

The successful candidate must have:

  ‚Ä¢ A suitable work environment

  ‚Ä¢ Reliable internet connection

  ‚Ä¢ A work PC or laptop

  ‚Ä¢ Willingness to screen share due to the sensitive nature of the work

 

Main Duties

  ‚Ä¢ Bookkeeping / Bank Reconciliation

  ‚Ä¢ Preparing Tax / VAT Returns

  ‚Ä¢ Preparing Financial Accounts

  ‚Ä¢ Payroll / Pension

 

Responsibilities

  ‚Ä¢ Record day-to-day financial transactions and complete the posting process

  ‚Ä¢ Verify that transactions are recorded in the correct ledgers (day book, suppliers, customers, general ledger)

  ‚Ä¢ Bring the books to the trial balance stage

  ‚Ä¢ Perform partial checks of the posting process

  ‚Ä¢ Bank reconciliation

  ‚Ä¢ Complete tax returns and prepare VAT returns

  ‚Ä¢ Enter data, maintain records, and prepare reports and financial statements

  ‚Ä¢ Process accounts receivable/payable and handle payroll in a timely manner

  ‚Ä¢ Provide administrative and clerical support as needed

  ‚Ä¢ Perform additional bookkeeping duties as designated by management

 

Education & Experience

  ‚Ä¢ Proven bookkeeping experience

  ‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of bookkeeping principles

  ‚Ä¢ Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles and procedures

  ‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of relevant computer applications, spreadsheets, and accounting software (preferably Xero Accounting & QuickBooks ‚Äì training can be provided)

  ‚Ä¢ Knowledge of data management and financial data analysis

 

Key Competencies

  ‚Ä¢ Planning and organising

  ‚Ä¢ Strong mathematical skills (basic arithmetic essential)

  ‚Ä¢ High degree of accuracy and attention to detail

  ‚Ä¢ Information collection and monitoring

  ‚Ä¢ Problem analysis and problem solving

  ‚Ä¢ Proficiency in English and MS Office

  ‚Ä¢ Strong communication and customer service skills

  ‚Ä¢ Confidentiality and discretion with sensitive financial information

  ‚Ä¢ Integrity

 

Benefits

  ‚Ä¢ Opportunities for promotion

  ‚Ä¢ Pathway to permanent employment

  ‚Ä¢ Work from home arrangement

  ‚Ä¢ Medical cover (upon permanent employment)

  ‚Ä¢ 22 days Paid Leave, including National (Regular) Holidays

 

Schedule

  ‚Ä¢ Fixed 8-hour shift

  ‚Ä¢ Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM ‚Äì 5:00 PM London Time (with 1-hour unpaid break)

 

Compensation

  ‚Ä¢ Php 30,000.00 during probation

  ‚Ä¢ Increased to Php 40,000.00 after probation

  ‚Ä¢ Increased to Php 50,000.00 after 6-month review 

  ‚Ä¢ 13th month bonus

 

Application Requirements

 Candidates should confirm the following in their application:

  ‚Ä¢ Comfort with the working hours stated above

  ‚Ä¢ Availability to commence from a specific date

  ‚Ä¢ Current working status

  ‚Ä¢ Attach a copy of their Resume

?

title: Job Title: Video Editor (Adobe Premiere) ‚Äì Social, Podcast & YouTube ‚Äì Import/Export Brands
description:
Video Editor (Long-Term)

Company: Australia-based Media & Marketing Team

We are an Australian media team working with three brands in the import, export, and logistics industry. We produce short-form social videos, podcast episodes, promo content, event coverage, and YouTube content. We are looking for a reliable and skilled Video Editor to join us long-term. This is a consistent role with structured workflow and clear briefs.



About the Role

This is primarily a video editing position. You will work closely with our internal team to deliver clean, fast, and organised edits. You must be comfortable working inside shared drives and structured folders.



Expected Monthly Volume (Approximate)

8‚Äì12 short-form videos per week (Reels / Shorts / LinkedIn)

2 podcast episodes per month

5‚Äì10 short clips per podcast episode

1‚Äì2 promo or event highlight videos per month

Workload may increase over time.



Responsibilities

Video Editing: Edit short-form videos for social media, edit promo and event videos, edit full podcast episodes (multi-camera sync), create short podcast clips from long-form content, create clean and professional video openers, create short paid ads for social platforms.

Audio: Basic audio cleanup, balance voices, reduce background noise, apply light compression and polish.

YouTube: Upload and manage YouTube videos, optimise titles, descriptions, and tags, create thumbnails (Canva is acceptable).

Graphics: Create simple social graphics using Canva.



File Organisation (Critical Requirement)

All projects must be structured so that other editors can open and modify them, all assets are properly linked, folder structures are clean and logical, sequences are clearly named, and no files are missing. We work in a collaborative team environment. Clean file management is essential.



Workflow

All tasks are managed inside Trello. You must be comfortable working with structured task boards, updating task status daily, following checklists, and communicating clearly within each task. Deadlines and task tracking are handled strictly through Trello.



Time Zone Requirement

You must be available to work within or close to the Melbourne, Australia (AEST/AEDT) time zone. This is essential for daily communication, revisions, and real-time collaboration. If you are located in a different time zone, you must clearly explain how you will overlap with Melbourne working hours.



Skills Required

Strong Adobe Premiere Pro skills. Experience editing podcasts (multi-camera sync and audio management). Experience creating short clips from long-form content. Basic understanding of YouTube channel management. Canva for simple graphics. Strong file management habits. Stable internet connection.

Bonus: Basic knowledge of After Effects.



What We‚Äôre Looking For

Detail-oriented, fast turnaround, clear communicator, comfortable receiving feedback, long-term mindset, reliable and organised.



What We Offer

Consistent weekly work, clear direction and structured briefs, long-term collaboration, opportunity to grow into a senior or lead editor role, professional and organised team environment.



To Apply

Please send your portfolio (social videos and podcast edits preferred), examples of podcast edits, YouTube channels you have managed (if any), your hourly rate, your weekly availability, and a short explanation of your workflow and how you organise project files. We are looking to start soon. If you are organised, reliable, and interested in long-term consistent work, apply now.

title: AI Developer / Vibe Coder ‚Äì Build Fast with Modern AI Tools
description:
About the Role

We're a growing AI automation services company that builds custom applications, integrations, and workflow automations for businesses. We move fast, ship often, and lean heavily on AI-powered development tools to deliver high-quality solutions in a fraction of the time.



We're looking for a developer who knows how to vibe code ‚Äî someone who can take a concept, spin up an AI coding tool, and turn it into a working application quickly. You don't need 10 years of traditional software engineering experience. You need to be resourceful, fast, and comfortable building with AI as your co-pilot.



What You'll Be Doing



Building full-stack applications, integrations, and automations for clients

Working with Supabase as the primary backend ‚Äî setting up databases, auth, edge functions, row-level security, and real-time features

Connecting systems through APIs ‚Äî REST, webhooks, and third-party integrations

Using AI coding tools like Claude Code, OpenAI Codex, Cursor, or similar to accelerate development

Collaborating through GitHub using proper workflows (see below)

Turning client requirements into working solutions rapidly ‚Äî we're talking days, not months





GitHub & Version Control Skills

This is important to us. You should be comfortable with:



Branching strategies ‚Äî creating feature branches, working off main or dev, and keeping things organized

Pull requests ‚Äî opening PRs with clear descriptions, requesting reviews, and addressing feedback

Merging & conflict resolution ‚Äî handling merge conflicts cleanly without breaking things

Commit hygiene ‚Äî writing meaningful commit messages, making atomic commits, not pushing everything in one giant blob

Issues & project boards ‚Äî using GitHub Issues to track tasks and stay aligned

Branch protection & collaboration ‚Äî understanding why we don't push directly to main





What We're Looking For



Hands-on experience with Supabase (PostgreSQL, auth, storage, edge functions)

Solid understanding of APIs ‚Äî building them, consuming them, debugging them

Experience using AI coding tools (Claude Code, Codex, Cursor, Copilot, Windsurf, etc.)

Proficiency with GitHub ‚Äî not just git push, but real collaborative workflows

Comfortable with JavaScript/TypeScript, React, and/or Next.js

Self-starter who can take a loose brief and figure out the best path forward

Strong English communication skills ‚Äî you'll be working directly with clients at times





Nice to Have



Experience with n8n, Make, or other automation platforms

Familiarity with MCP servers and tool integrations

Background in building Chrome extensions, Slack bots, or internal tools

Understanding of prompt engineering and working with LLM APIs





Why Work With Us



You'll be building real products for real clients ‚Äî not maintaining legacy code

We embrace AI tools and expect you to use them ‚Äî speed and quality matter more than typing every line by hand

Growth opportunity as the company scales ‚Äî this is a ground-floor role

Flexible schedule with async-friendly communication





How to Apply

Send us a message with:



A brief intro about yourself and your experience

A project or example where you used AI tools to build something fast

Your GitHub profile (or a link to relevant work)

Your availability and rate expectations

title: Marketing Assistant - Product Launch Campaign (AI-Powered Tech Startup)
description:
Join a Growing AI-Powered Tech Startup ‚Äî Growth Opportunity



  Keynodex is building the KeynodeLink Network ‚Äî an AI-powered professional growth network that's

  redefining how professionals connect. Our flagship product, KeynodeCard, is a QR-based digital

  business card platform with patent-pending voice technology.



  We're preparing for our product launch campaign and looking for a motivated Marketing Assistant to

  join our team and grow with us.





  WHAT YOU'LL DO





  ‚Ä¢ Execute social media campaigns across LinkedIn, Instagram,
,
/X, and TikTok

  ‚Ä¢ Create and schedule marketing content (posts, stories, short-form video scripts)

  ‚Ä¢ Assist with
 marketing campaigns and outreach

  ‚Ä¢ Research competitors, trends, and potential partnership opportunities

  ‚Ä¢ Help manage our online presence and community engagement

  ‚Ä¢ Track campaign performance and report on key metrics

  ‚Ä¢ Support product launch activities and promotional campaigns



  REQUIRED SKILLS & TOOLS





  Must have experience with:

  ? Slack ‚Äî This is our primary team communication tool. You must be comfortable using Slack daily for

  updates, tasks, and collaboration.

  ? AI Tools (ChatGPT, Claude, or similar) ‚Äî We use AI extensively. You should already be using AI

  tools to improve your work (writing, research, brainstorming). This is non-negotiable.

  ? Social Media Platforms ‚Äî Hands-on experience managing business accounts (not just personal use)

  ? Canva or similar design tools ‚Äî For creating marketing graphics for posts and video content

  ? Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)

  ? Strong written English ‚Äî Clear, professional, and engaging copy



  Nice to have:

  ‚Ä¢ Experience with
 marketing tools (Mailchimp, Resend, etc.)

  ‚Ä¢ Good understanding of SEO

  ‚Ä¢ Video editing skills (CapCut, Premiere, etc.)

  ‚Ä¢ Experience with CRM or project management tools



 

  WHAT WE OFFER





Starting Salary: $
/month (based on experience)

Performance Bonuses: Quota-based bonuses tied to campaign results ‚Äî hit your targets, earn more

Growth Opportunity: This is a ground-floor position at a startup preparing for launch. As we grow,

so does your role and compensation.

100% Remote ‚Äî Work from anywhere in the Philippines

Flexible schedule with core overlap hours



 

  IMPORTANT DETAILS



Two-Week Probationary Period: All new hires start with a paid 2-week probation. This is for both of

 us to confirm it's a good fit. You'll receive clear expectations and daily check-ins during this

 period.



Performance-Based Culture: We set clear quotas and KPIs. If you meet or exceed them, you earn

bonuses. If you consistently underperform, we'll work with you to improve ‚Äî but we expect effort and

accountability.



AI-First Team: We don't just "allow" AI ‚Äî we expect you to use it. If you're not already using

ChatGPT or Claude to improve your work, this role is not for you.



  HOW TO APPLY





ATTENTION!! Failure to follow the instructions below will result in no consideration for the role.



Apply here: 



  You'll need:

  ‚Ä¢ Answer a few role-specific questions



  Applications submitted through our website get priority review.



  Keynodex ‚Äî help us build the future of intelligent identity infrastructure.

title: Long-form Video Editor
description:
Who We Are







Market Leaders is on a mission to become a world-renowned coaching and marketing education brand by 2031. With Asian roots and global reach, we bring a "Bruce Lee approach" to business education‚Äîcombining Eastern wisdom with world-class execution.







Our culture? Peaceful & Profitable. We believe in high performance without toxic hustle, building a remote team that wins together and celebrates together.







We're a tight-knit team of 9 scaling globally, and we need a strategic long-form video editor who understands that great content isn't just polished‚Äîit drives transformation.







The Opportunity







You'll be our Long-form Video Storyteller‚Äîthe person who transforms raw footage into engaging educational experiences that teach, inspire, and spread our mission across YouTube, course platforms, and webinars.







This isn't a "churn and burn" editing gig. You'll produce 4-6 high-quality long-form videos per month (10-60+ minutes each) while collaborating directly with our Co-founders (Bryan Ang, CMO + Melvin Soh, Head of Creatives) and Content Manager to shape how we educate globally.







This role is for someone who:







Sees editing as storytelling architecture, not just technical execution



Obsesses over audio quality (because bad audio kills great content)



Can balance high volume (4-6 videos/month) with world-class quality



Wants to build something meaningful, not just collect a paycheck







What You'll Do







Video Production & Editing (Your Craft)







Edit 4-6 long-form videos monthly (10-60 min each) across YouTube, Amplifyyy (course platform), webinars, and podcast video



Process ~3 hours of raw footage monthly into polished, engaging educational content



Execute seamless cuts, transitions, b-roll, and motion graphics that enhance (not distract from) teaching



Ensure every frame reflects Market Leaders' brand‚Äîconsistent, professional, globally excellent







Storytelling & Retention (Your Edge)







Structure long-form content for maximum retention (chapter breaks, pacing, hooks, payoffs)



Adapt Hormozi-style pacing (high-energy, retention-focused) to Market Leaders' voice



Create engaging openings that hook viewers in the first 30 seconds



Maintain narrative flow over 10-60 minutes (keep viewers watching, not clicking away)







Content Optimization (Your Systems)







Repurpose long-form content into clip libraries with timestamps for short-form team



Optimize videos for platform-specific best practices (YouTube retention, course clarity, webinar engagement)



Add captions, subtitles, and accessibility features (inclusive content wins)



Manage content library (organized raw footage, project files, exports‚Äîsearchable and efficient)







Audio Excellence (Your Non-Negotiable)







Mix clean dialogue, balance music layers, and eliminate distracting noise



Ensure audio quality matches visual polish (no glitches, no volume jumps, professional sound design)



Apply EQ, compression, and sound design to keep listeners engaged







Creative Collaboration (Your Team Play)







Work closely with Content Manager on briefs, timelines, and feedback loops



Align with Melvin (Head of Creatives) on brand aesthetics and creative direction



Implement Bryan's strategic vision while contributing your editorial insights



Balance input from multiple stakeholders without ego or drama







Continuous Improvement (Your Growth)







Create video templates and presets (intros/outros, lower thirds, color grades) for efficiency



Document processes and workflows for scalability



Update and re-edit old content for repurposing



Stay current with long-form content trends and retention strategies







What You Bring







Must-Haves (Non-Negotiable)







Experience & Portfolio



2+ years editing long-form video (10-60+ min content‚ÄîYouTube, courses, webinars, NOT just vlogs or entertainment)



Portfolio with links to your work (show us videos you've edited, ideally in education/coaching/business space)



Proven ability to produce 4-6 videos/month without sacrificing quality (show us you've handled consistent volume)



Experience with educational/coaching content (business education, thought leaders, course creation‚Äînot just lifestyle or entertainment)







Technical Skills







Mastery of video editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or CapCut Pro‚Äîquality matters more than the tool)







Audio mixing fundamentals (clean dialogue, music layering, noise reduction, EQ basics‚Äîaudio quality is non-negotiable)







Color grading (consistent, professional look across all videos)







Pacing for retention (you know how to keep viewers engaged for 10-60+ minutes‚Äîchapter breaks, cuts, b-roll timing)







Basic motion graphics (text overlays, lower thirds, simple animations using built-in editing tools)







Strategic Mindset







Deep understanding of long-form storytelling (narrative arc, hooks, retention tactics, payoff structure)



Experience structuring educational content (modules, lessons, clear teaching flow‚Äînot just entertainment)



Asset management discipline (organized project files, version control, searchable libraries)



Familiarity with YouTube/webinar/course formats (platform-specific best practices)







Work Ethic & Execution







Deadline-driven (4-6 videos/month = consistent output, no missed deliveries)



Detail-obsessed (you catch the audio glitch at minute 47, the color shift at 22:30, the awkward cut at 8:15)



Self-directed but collaborative (works independently but communicates proactively with team)



Organized (file naming, backup systems, version control are second nature)







Cultural Alignment



Handles feedback without ego (multiple revision rounds = growth, not personal attacks)



Team-first mentality (collaboration over "artistic vision"‚Äîbusiness results matter)



Proactive communicator (flags issues early, updates team without being asked‚Äîespecially critical in async remote work)



Peaceful & Profitable mindset (focused 6-8 hour days, speaks up on unrealistic timelines, no burnout glorification)







Nice-to-Haves (Bonus Points)







Audio podcast editing experience (audio-only mixing, noise reduction, Audition/Logic Pro skills)



Thumbnail design skills (Canva/Photoshop basics‚Äîcollaborate with graphic designer)



Moderate After Effects skills (2D animations, kinetic typography‚Äîtakes motion graphics to the next level)



Template creation (Premiere Pro presets, project templates, efficiency systems)



Event/retreat videography editing (highlight reels, keynote recordings, multi-cam editing)



Course platform experience (Amplifyyy, Teachable, Kajabi‚Äîunderstands e-learning video requirements)



Content repurposing workflows (clip libraries, timestamp systems, multi-platform optimization)



Agency or high-volume environment experience (used to fast feedback cycles, tight deadlines)







Direct Access to Leadership



You'll collaborate regularly with our Co-founders (Bryan & Melvin) and Content Manager. Your ideas will be heard, tested, and implemented‚Äînot buried in corporate bureaucracy. You're joining a 7-person team where your work directly impacts our global mission.







Growth & Learning



Long-form content is evolving rapidly (AI tools, retention strategies, new formats). You'll be encouraged (and supported) to learn new techniques, test bold ideas, and evolve your craft continuously. Early tea
mbers help shape our creative direction.







Quarterly Team Retreats



We gather 3-4 times per year across Asia to connect, celebrate wins, and build culture in person. (Yes, we actually like each other. These aren't boring corporate offsites‚Äîthey're genuine celebrations.)







Mission-Driven Work



You're not just editing videos‚Äîyou're helping spread business wisdom that changes lives. Our content educates entrepreneurs globally, blending Asian philosophy with world-class strategy. Every video you craft helps someone build a better business.







Creative Freedom in a Structured Environment



We have high standards (Hormozi-level quality), but we trust our creatives. You'll get clear briefs and strategic direction, then have creative freedom to execute. We want your editorial insights, not robotic button-pushing.







Compensation & Stability



SGD $
/month (full-time, remote)



Stable monthly income (no more unpredictable freelance feast-or-famine)



Freelancers seeking a home base: this is it



Agency editors escaping burnout: this is your sanctuary





Apply Now!





Please submit your application here:
