title: Australian (AU) Senior Tax Accountant
description:
RGA Business and Tax Accountants is a leading accounting firm renowned for providing comprehensive tax, accounting, and advisory services to a diverse clientele. We are committed to excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced 5+ years Australian Senior Public Practice Accountant to join our dedicated team and contribute to our clients' success. Our business has successfully engaged experienced outsourced professionals from the Philippines since 2019. Applicants who are currently working for TOA and wish to work from home will be highly regarded. 



Visit our website: 
 



Why Join Us:

‚Ä¢ Competitive salary package (110,000 pesos per month)

‚Ä¢ Opportunities for career advancement and professional growth.

‚Ä¢ Supportive and collaborative work environment.

‚Ä¢ Access to ongoing training and development programs.

‚Ä¢ Work-life balance with flexible scheduling options.

‚Ä¢ Permanent work from home set-up.

‚Ä¢ New equipment supplied.



Position Summary: 

As the Senior Accountant, your role will involve mentoring junior staff, and ensuring the delivery of accurate and timely financial information. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in public accounting, strong technical skills, and the ability to build and maintain client relationships.



Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Prepare and review complex individual, corporate, partnership, and trust tax returns.

‚Ä¢ Prepare and review financial statements, ensuring compliance with applicable accounting standards.

‚Ä¢ Train junior accountants, providing guidance and support to enhance their professional development.

‚Ä¢ Stay current on changes in tax laws, regulations, and accounting standards, and share knowledge with the team.

‚Ä¢ Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and service quality.



Skills:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA or equivalent certification is required.

‚Ä¢ Minimum of 5 years of experience in Australian public practice accounting, with a focus on tax and financial reporting.

‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of tax laws, regulations, and accounting standards.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Xero, QuickBooks) and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

‚Ä¢ Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.

‚Ä¢ Superior verbal and written communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.

‚Ä¢ Proven leadership and team management skills.

‚Ä¢ High level of integrity and professionalism.



If you are an experienced and dedicated accounting professional looking to advance your career in public practice, we encourage you to apply.We look forward to meeting you!

title: AI VIDEO Creator (UGC)
description:
AI Video Creator ‚Äî UGC & Performance Creatives



Ads on Tap is looking for an AI Video Creator who pushes the boundaries of what's possible with AI-generated content ‚Äî producing UGC-style ad creatives so authentic they're indistinguishable from real footage.



About Ads on Tap



Ads on Tap combines creative agency expertise with software innovation to deliver high-quality, data-driven ad creatives for e-commerce brands. We've helped scale brands to $30M+ in revenue through our systematic, data-obsessed approach to creative testing and optimization. Our unique methodology moves beyond basic UGC to create story-driven content that not only captures attention but drives real business results.



What You'll Do:



Create photorealistic AI-generated UGC videos for paid social campaigns (Meta, TikTok, YouTube)

Produce AI avatars and talking-head content that passes as genuine creator footage ‚Äî natural expressions, realistic lip sync, authentic movement

Edit and post-produce AI-generated footage to ad-ready quality, including pacing, sound design, captions, and hooks

Combine AI-generated elements with real footage, b-roll, and product shots for seamless hybrid creatives

Stay on the bleeding edge of AI video tools and techniques ‚Äî evaluate new models, workflows, and platforms as they launch

Build and maintain a library of reusable AI personas, styles, and templates for rapid creative iteration

Collaborate with Creative Strategists to translate ad concepts and scripts into finished video assets

Produce volume ‚Äî support high-output creative testing cycles with fast turnaround on variations and iterations

Develop internal SOPs and best practices for AI video production workflows

Tools & Platforms (some or all of):



AI Video Generation: Kling, Minimax, Vidu, Runway, Pika, Synthesia, HeyGen, D-ID

AI Image Generation: Midjourney, Flux, DALL-E, Stable Diffusion

AI Audio/Voice: ElevenLabs, PlayHT

Editing & Post-Production: CapCut, DaVinci Resolve, Premiere Pro, After Effects

Asset Management: Google Drive, Notion

About You:



Deep hands-on experience with current AI video generation tools ‚Äî you know which model to use for what and how to prompt for photorealistic results

Sharp eye for the uncanny valley ‚Äî you know exactly what makes AI footage look fake and how to fix it (micro-expressions, hand movement, lighting consistency, temporal coherence)

Strong video editing skills ‚Äî you can take raw AI output and polish it into scroll-stopping ad creative

Understanding of direct-response ad formats and what performs on Meta, TikTok, and YouTube

Portfolio demonstrating AI-generated video work that genuinely looks real (this is non-negotiable ‚Äî we will ask for samples)

Ability to work fast and iterate ‚Äî performance creative is a volume game

Self-directed learner who independently keeps up with a landscape that changes weekly

Clear written communication in English

Available to overlap with EU working hours

Nice to Have:



Experience with ComfyUI, Wan, or custom AI video pipelines

Background in UGC-style content creation or performance marketing

Familiarity with AI voice cloning and lip-sync workflows

Understanding of ad creative testing frameworks and performance metrics (hook rate, hold rate, CTR)

At Ads on Tap, our culture thrives on:



Smart, humble & hungry team players

Data-driven decision making

Proactive problem-solving

Remote-first collaboration

Clear communication

Continuous learning and improvement

Building scalable systems

Benefits:



Work with industry leaders who've scaled brands to $30M+

Fully remote work environment

Competitive compensation package

Be part of a rapidly growing creative tech company

Work at the frontier of AI-generated content ‚Äî shape how the next generation of ads gets made

Learn from experts in e-commerce and performance marketing

To Apply:



Please submit your CV, a cover letter, and a portfolio or reel of AI-generated video work. In your application, include:



Which AI video tools you use most and why

A breakdown of one AI video you created ‚Äî what tools, what challenges, what made it work

Your process for making AI-generated UGC look authentic

We're looking forward to hearing from you!



Best regards,



The Ads on Tap Team

title: Marketing Executive | Remote | UK Property Company
description:
Work From Home | Long Term Career Growth | AI, Content, SEO and Paid Ads



Bi-weekly Pay



Luxury Hub and Pure Green are fast growing UK based property companies managing over ¬£20m in assets and securing ¬£30m in investment funding for future developments.



We operate at the intersection of property, technology, performance marketing and social impact, delivering modern estate agency and lettings services across the UK.



We are expanding our Philippines based team and are hiring a Marketing Executive for a long term, full time role focused on execution, performance and continuous improvement.



This role is ideal for someone who is tech savvy, design aware, comfortable with AI and happy to be hands on across content, SEO,
, website updates and automation.



WHY JOIN US



‚Ä¢ Work remotely for a stable UK based company

‚Ä¢ Long term role with guaranteed hours and job security

‚Ä¢ Real campaigns with real budgets

‚Ä¢ Daily use of AI tools including ChatGPT, Canva AI and CapCut AI

‚Ä¢ Exposure to UK marketing strategy, funnels and performance data

‚Ä¢ Work closely with senior leadership including CMO and Operations

‚Ä¢ Clear progression as the business scales

‚Ä¢ Annual performance review with potential pay increase



We invest in our people. You will get support and systems to help you grow your skills and confidence, not just complete tasks.



OUR CULTURE AND VALUES



At Luxury Hub, culture matters. We are building a long term team, not short term contractors.



Our core values are:



‚Ä¢ Shared Vision ‚Äì Aligning personal ambition with company success and shared goals

‚Ä¢ Virtue and Talents ‚Äì Individual talents are recognised and nurtured

‚Ä¢ Continuous Improvement ‚Äì We welcome feedback, stay curious, innovate and improve

‚Ä¢ Focused Contribution ‚Äì We play to our strengths and passions to create real impact

‚Ä¢ Meaningful Partnerships ‚Äì We believe in mutual value creation and growing together



We are looking for people who want to build something meaningful, grow their skills and contribute beyond just completing tasks.



WHAT YOU WILL DO

Marketing and Campaign Execution



‚Ä¢ Execute weekly and monthly marketing campaigns across digital channels

‚Ä¢ Manage and maintain marketing action lists and content calendars

‚Ä¢ Create marketing assets, posts and supporting materials

‚Ä¢ Research trends, competitors and opportunities across social platforms



Paid Advertising



‚Ä¢ Assist with Meta Ads and Google Display campaigns

‚Ä¢ Create ad creatives, hooks, captions and visuals

‚Ä¢ Monitor CPL, CTR and conversions

‚Ä¢ Suggest and apply optimisations



SEO, GEO and Website Updates



‚Ä¢ Support basic SEO and GEO tasks including on page optimisation, content updates and metadata

‚Ä¢ Carry out basic website updates such as CMS edits, landing pages and content changes

‚Ä¢ Work with the team to improve website performance and conversion



AI, Automation and Continuous Improvement



‚Ä¢ Use AI tools daily to generate content ideas, captions, scripts, designs and workflows

‚Ä¢ Identify opportunities to automate or improve marketing processes using AI

‚Ä¢ Continuously look for ways to work smarter and faster



 Campaigns, CRM and Reporting



‚Ä¢ Support
 campaigns, outbound
ing and basic automations

‚Ä¢ Maintain and update CRM records

‚Ä¢ Track leads, campaigns and sources

‚Ä¢ Support basic marketing performance reporting



Brand and Quality Control



‚Ä¢ Maintain strict brand consistency

‚Ä¢ Continuously improve output quality across all channels



WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR



We are skills first, not CV first.



You should have:



‚Ä¢ Demonstrable experience in digital marketing, content creation, SEO or paid ads

‚Ä¢ Strong Canva skills and a good design eye

‚Ä¢ Ability to edit short form videos using CapCut, Premiere Pro or similar tools

‚Ä¢ Confidence using AI tools daily

‚Ä¢ Comfort working with website backends or CMS and learning new tools quickly

‚Ä¢ Strong written English

‚Ä¢ A proactive, improvement focused mindset

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

‚Ä¢ Availability to work UK hours from 9 AM to 5 PM GMT

‚Ä¢ No other full time job or full time study commitments



A portfolio or examples of previous work is required.



COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS



‚Ä¢ PHP 318 to 330 per hour based on skills and portfolio

‚Ä¢ Bi weekly pay

‚Ä¢ Paid time off

‚Ä¢ KPI based performance bonuses of up to PHP 35 per hour extra

‚Ä¢ Annual performance and pay review



Guaranteed pay security

If we do not provide enough work, you will still be paid for at least 75 percent of your contracted hours.



As the company grows, we plan to introduce:



‚Ä¢ Thirteenth month pay

‚Ä¢ Fourteenth month performance bonus after three years

‚Ä¢ Bonus days off every 80 hours worked after probation

‚Ä¢ Health stipend of up to PHP 2,000 per month after two years

‚Ä¢ Increased leave credits

‚Ä¢ Expanded long term benefits

‚Ä¢ Company loan options after two years



HOW TO APPLY



‚Ä¢ Complete this short application form: 

‚Ä¢ No CV required at this stage. Portfolio will be reviewed.



 Join us and grow your career with a UK-based real estate company. We will be accepting applications until 10th March 2026, 11:59 PM GMT.

title: Data Entry Staff
description:
AllForU is a Singapore youth marketing tech company. We are looking to expand our admin team. We are hiring detailed oriented admins who are confident of ensuring our administrative are upkeep and are proficient in both spoken and written English which will be used on a daily basis.



We are looking for professionals with at least 1 years of working experience. However, Final-year university student and fresh graduate are welcome to apply as well.



**Benefits:**



- Work from home role

- Full time - Monday to Friday, 9am to 6.30pm (Tues to Sat or Sun to Thurs

- We honor Philippines Holidays

- Direct report to CEO



**Your main responsibilities may include but are not limited to:**



- **Data Quality & Accuracy Operations:** Work heavily on electronic records, which can involve data research; (sorting, reviewing and cleaning) data entries; and approving data entries to ensure data quality and accuracy standards are achieve. You will need to adjust your work schedule accordingly to the events needed to support.

- **Improve Revenue Through Data:** Analyse data quality trends that impact the company‚Äôs revenue and develop solutions that resolve/enhances it. Creating reports that detail data quality issues and solutions for senior leadership

- **Resolve Data-Quality Issues:** Resolve issues surrounding bad data. Outreach and provide immediate support and responses to stakeholders that provided bad data to resubmit correct data.

- **Maintain In-app Service & Rewards Inventory:** Maintain, research and implement new digital inventories within Eunico App: missions, quest, rewards and user management.

- **International Team:** Working closely in an english-speaking environment with a cross-functional global team across Singapore, Philippines and Myanmar. Reporting directly to Senior Sponsorship Executive and CEO.

- ** Create post for our instagram and
 accounts using 
, capcut etc



**Requirements:**



- Proficient and confident in both spoken and written English.

- Analytical mindset.

- Excellent attention to fine details.

- Able to work independently

- Proficient with computers.

- Fast internet connection and have backup power generator/battery

- (Bonus) Have experience using CRM (Salesforce, Marketo, Pardot ‚Ä¶ etc)



**Personality:**



- Must be vibrant and highly self-motivated.

- Able to handle a stressful work environment.

- A good team player as we work as a tight-knitted team.

- Confidence in managing multiple projects and deadlines effectively.



If you believe you have what it takes, complete this job application form and we will get back to you asap.



swiy.co/AllForU-Job-Application



Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Executive Assistant & Operations Coordinator (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote|Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready‚Ä¶

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role ‚Äî you‚Äôll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

‚Ä¢ Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

‚Ä¢ We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

‚Ä¢ Not a fan of office politics or drama? We‚Äôre on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

‚Ä¢ 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

‚Ä¢ Competitive salary

‚Ä¢ Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

‚Ä¢ Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

‚Ä¢ Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

‚Ä¢ Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

‚Ä¢ Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We‚Äôre a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that‚Äôs making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we‚Äôve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world‚Äôs most successful launches in their categories. We‚Äôve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we‚Äôre continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You‚Äôre always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR:

We‚Äôre looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role‚Äîsomeone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and ‚Äúgetting things done‚Äù? If yes, we want you on our team!



You‚Äôre probably the type of person who:

‚Ä¢ Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

‚Ä¢ Has strong communication and organizational skills

‚Ä¢ Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

‚Ä¢ Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

‚Ä¢ Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We‚Äôre not just looking for someone who can support our team, we‚Äôre looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You‚Äôll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role ‚Äî one where you‚Äôll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

‚Ä¢ Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

‚Ä¢ Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

‚Ä¢ Want to learn how to manage projects? Let‚Äôs go!



We‚Äôre not just hiring for a role ‚Äî we‚Äôre hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) ‚Äî giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

‚Ä¢ Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

‚Ä¢ Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

‚Ä¢ Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

‚Ä¢ Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

‚Ä¢ Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

‚Ä¢ Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

‚Ä¢ Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

‚Ä¢ Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

‚Ä¢ Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

‚Ä¢ Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

‚Ä¢ Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns ‚Äî manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

‚Ä¢ Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

‚Ä¢ Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

‚Ä¢ Take ownership of ad hoc ‚Äúfigure it out‚Äù tasks ‚Äî we‚Äôll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You‚Äôll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we‚Äôll support your learning ‚Äî but we‚Äôre looking for someone who‚Äôs excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves ‚Äî as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you‚Äôll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

‚Ä¢ 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

‚Ä¢ Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills ‚Äî you‚Äôre detail-obsessed and on top of things

‚Ä¢ Proactive problem-solver ‚Äî you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

‚Ä¢ Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

‚Ä¢ Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

‚Ä¢ Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

‚Ä¢ Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

‚Ä¢ Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

‚Ä¢ Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúExperience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus‚Äù







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it‚Äôs too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you‚Äôre still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we‚Äôd love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we‚Äôve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we‚Äôll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: Supply Chain & Materials Specialist
description:
Plantaer Inc.

Part-Time / As-Needed  |  Remote



About Us

Plantaer Inc. is a small company developing sustainable construction materials. We‚Äôre looking for a driven, detail-oriented Supply Chain & Materials Specialist to help us source, manage, produce, and deliver materials.



Job Summary

You will lead and manage Plantaers‚Äô end-to-end supply chain, including sourcing materials globally, understanding material properties, maintaining comprehensive data records, coordinating deliveries via phone and
, and supporting payment logistics. Hours vary based on business needs, with potential to grow. We‚Äôd love to build a long-term relationship with the right person!



Key Responsibilities

Supply Chain Management: Lead the full supply chain from sourcing through delivery. Identify, evaluate, and negotiate with global suppliers. Place orders and track shipments to ensure on-time delivery.

Import & Export: Manage international shipping logistics, including customs documentation, duties, tariffs, and compliance with trade regulations. Coordinate with freight carriers and forwarding partners.

Materials Sourcing & Knowledge: Source raw materials globally. Develop a thorough understanding of all material properties, specifications, and quality standards. Research alternatives to optimize cost and quality.

Phone &
 Coordination: Make calls to suppliers, freight carriers, and logistics partners to arrange deliveries and resolve issues. Serve as the primary point of contact for the supply chain.

Data Management: Maintain detailed records of all supply chain data (orders, inventory, costs, lead times, and supplier info). Update tracking databases and generate regular performance reports.

Process Improvement: Identify efficiency improvements, document SOPs, and stay current on trade regulations and supply chain best practices.



Requirements

Complete fluency in English (written and verbal) is mandatory. You will make phone calls, write
s, and communicate with partners and clients.

Proven experience in supply chain management, procurement, or materials sourcing

Hands-on experience with import/export processes, customs, and international trade compliance

Strong understanding of material properties, specifications, and quality standards

Excellent organizational skills with high accuracy and attention to detail

Proficiency with spreadsheets, databases, and inventory tracking tools

Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently

Reliable internet, quiet environment for calls, and proficiency with Zoom, Teams,
, and Google Suite

Professional studies and experience in Supply Chain, Business, Engineering, or related field preferred



Desired Skills

Experience with ERP, supply chain software, or freight forwarding platforms

Experience working with international suppliers across multiple regions

Knowledge of sustainability-focused or plant-based product supply chains

Familiarity with HubSpot, Airtable, or similar tools



What We Offer

Flexible, part-time schedule that works around your availability

Opportunities for increased hours and growth as the company scales

The chance to make a real impact at a small company



How to Apply



Please include: a brief explanation of why you‚Äôd be a good fit, your ideal hourly rate, a summary of your supply chain and import/export experience, and any sample work or references. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Video Producer
description:
About Us

We run pay-per-call affiliate campaigns for pest control services in the Dallas-Fort Worth area. Our ads appear on major publisher sites like NBC News, Bloomberg, MSN, and Weather Channel through native advertising platforms. We need consistent, high-quality creative assets to drive phone calls from homeowners dealing with pest problems.



The Role

We're looking for a creative editor who can produce editorial-style images and commercial videos that blend naturally with news content while driving strong click-to-call conversions.



Weekly Deliverables:



5-10 static images optimized for native ad platforms



1 short video (maximum 45 seconds) with compelling call-to-action



What You'll Create

Static Images:



Editorial-style visuals that match news site aesthetics



Pest-specific creatives (rodents, bed bugs, termites, mosquitoes, wildlife)



Localized messaging targeting DFW homeowners



3-4 variations per pest type for A/B testing



Videos:



Maximum 45 seconds with strong urgency



Commercial-use stock footage only



Clear call-to-action driving phone calls (not website clicks)



Professional editing with text overlays and branding



Seasonal themes matching our quarterly campaigns



Campaign Focus by Quarter

Q1 (Now): Rodents, bed bugs, wildlife seeking shelter



Q2: Termites, mosquitoes, ants (peak season)



Q3: Roaches, scorpions, spiders (summer heat)



Q4: Rodents and wildlife return



Requirements

Must Have:



2+ years creating assets for native ad platforms (Taboola, Outbrain, MGID)



Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite or equivalent (Canva Pro, CapCut, Premiere)



Experience sourcing and licensing stock media (Shutterstock, Storyblocks, Getty, Envato)



Understanding of native ad specs and platform requirements



Strong headline integration skills



Ability to create urgency without violating platform policies



Preferred:



Experience in home services, pest control, or local lead generation



Familiarity with pay-per-call or affiliate marketing compliance



Previous geo-targeted campaign work



Creative Direction

Your assets will support headlines like:



"Dallas Homeowners: Rodents Are Invading Attics This Winter"



"The Bed Bug Warning Signs Dallas Residents Miss"



"5 Signs Termites May Be Eating Your Dallas Home"



"Take Back Your Backyard: DFW Mosquito Season Is Here"



"Hearing Scratching in Your Walls? Here's What DFW Contractors Say"



The tone is informative but urgent. We're a referral service connecting homeowners with licensed contractors‚Äînot a pest control company directly.



Non-Negotiables

Human-created content only ‚Äì Absolutely no AI-generated images or videos



Commercial licensing ‚Äì All stock media must be cleared for paid advertising use



Weekly consistency ‚Äì Must reliably deliver assets on schedule



Iteration willingness ‚Äì Be ready to adjust based on performance data



Compensation

Contract/freelance basis



Approximately 10-15 hours per week



Open to per-asset pricing or weekly retainer



Ongoing engagement with potential to scale as campaigns grow



To Apply

Submit:



Portfolio link showing native ad or editorial-style advertising work



1-2 short commercial videos demonstrating stock footage editing and CTA integration



Brief description of your stock media licensing workflow



Your rate structure (per asset or weekly retainer)



Current availability and turnaround capacity



Screening Questions

Have you created advertising assets specifically for Taboola, MGID, or similar native platforms? Describe a campaign you worked on.



What stock media platforms do you use, and how do you ensure proper commercial licensing?



Can you confirm all deliverables with no AI-generated content?



Walk me through your process for creating a 45-second commercial video with a strong CTA.



What's your realistic turnaround time for 5-10 static images and 1 video per week?

title: After Effects Video Editor - 9:16 Reels & Ads
description:
We're looking for a skilled, adaptable video editor to handle high-volume 9:16 vertical reels and short ads in talking head format. Style varies per brief minimalist clean cuts with subtle text one day, bold kinetic typography on gradients (e.g., teal/dark with dashed accents), dynamic motion graphics the next. Goal: Polished, engaging content that boosts retention for social ads/reels (IG, TikTok, FB).

Key responsibilities:



Edit raw talking head footage: Tight pacing, silence removal, audio cleanup, eye contact correction if needed.

Add pro motion graphics: Kinetic text animations (pops, reveals, glows), gradients/overlays, dashed lines/shapes, subtle zooms/pans.

Adapt styles quickly based on reference (e.g., match provided examples/screenshots).

Export optimized 1080x1920 vertical, high bitrate for platforms.

Deliver fast turnarounds with revisions (aim for 1‚Äì2 day cycles on shorts).



Required skills/tools (non-negotiable):



Strong After Effects for custom motion graphics/animations (kinetic text, shape layers, keyframes).

Proficient in Premiere Pro or CapCut for base editing + AE integration.

Experience with 9:16 vertical reels/ads/talking heads (portfolio must show variety).

Creative eye for pacing, text sync, and visual polish.

Reliable communication (daily updates via chat/email).



Nice-to-have: CapCut mastery for quick prototypes, AI tools (e.g., eye contact filters), motion tracking.

To apply (important applications not following this will be ignored):



Attach 2‚Äì3 portfolio links/samples (Vimeo/YouTube/Drive) showing talking head reels with motion graphics.

Include a short note: "I'm excited about this because [1‚Äì2 sentences on why you fit + your rate expectation]."

Do a quick paid test: We'll send raw footage + style reference (e.g., screenshot example) for a 15‚Äì30s edit sample.



We're serious about long-term collaboration consistent work if we click. No agencies/recruiters.

title: Healthcare Virtual Assistant (Bilingual ‚Äì English / Spanish)
description:
Healthcare Virtual Assistant (Bilingual ‚Äì English / Spanish)



Work Schedule - Monday to Friday (Weekends Off) - Night Shift: 12:00 AM



‚Äì 9:00 AM PH Time - Equivalent to U.S. Pacific Time (PT) business hours - Shift adjusts during Daylight Saving Time transitions - U.S. Holidays Observed



Job Summary

-We are hiring a Bilingual Healthcare Virtual Assistant (English / Spanish) to provide remote administrative and patient support for U.S.-based medical specialists in urology, gynecology, pain management, and related fields.



-This role is best suited for candidates with experience in new patient enrollment, appointment scheduling, medical records coordination, insurance verification, prior authorizations, and EMR data entry.



-Responsibilities include registering new patients, creating and managing appointments, verifying insurance eligibility, processing authorizations, and ensuring accurate documentation within EMR systems.



-The position requires strong attention to detail, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage patient-related tasks independently in a fast-paced remote environment.



-Healthcare is a long-term, stable industry, and our company is committed to building a reliable, career-focused support team. We are proud to offer a role designed for long-term stability, consistency, and professional development.



-This role requires a high level of accuracy, attention to detail, and adherence to clinic workflows. Handling of sensitive patient information is a core responsibility of this role.



-Consistent attendance, punctuality, and reliability are critical for success, as the position directly supports live clinic operations and time-sensitive workflows.



Training Requirement (Important)

-Selected candidates must complete a training and evaluation period of approximately 1 to 2 weeks.



-This training period is initially non-paid and is intended to assess accuracy, communication skills, workflow understanding, and overall role fit.



-Candidates who successfully complete the training and transition to contract engagement will receive compensation for the full training period.



-Attendance, punctuality, and reliability during the training period are essential and will be considered as part of the evaluation process.



-Only candidates who successfully complete the training and evaluation process will proceed to contract engagement.



Role Scope & Responsibilities



-Daily responsibilities will focus on assigned workflow areas. Contractors typically handle one to three primary task categories depending on clinic needs and operational priorities.



Key Responsibilities



New Patient Enrollment & Appointment Management

- Register and enroll new patients in the EMR system



- Create, schedule, confirm, reschedule, and cancel appointments - Maintain accurate patient demographics and documentation



- Manage provider calendars and clinic schedules



- Handle urgent scheduling requests and last-minute changes



Medical Records Management



- Send and receive medical records via
 and fax



- Maintain accurate provider contact information - Respond to medical records requests



Insurance Eligibility & Verification



- Check and verify patient insurance eligibility and active coverage



- Review benefits and plan limitations



- Document eligibility details in the EMR system



Prior Authorization & Referral Coordination



- Process and track prior authorization requests



- Coordinate with insurance providers and clinic staff



- Monitor authorization status and follow up



EMR & Data Entry



- Enter and update patient records (e.g., eClinicalWorks)



- Upload supporting documentation



- Maintain accurate patient records



Patient & Provider Communication



- Communicate professionally via phone,
, and SMS



- Assist Spanish-speaking patients - Send confirmations and updates



Compliance & Accuracy



- Follow HIPAA and clinic-specific protocols



- Maintain high accuracy standards



- Escalate discrepancies promptly



Qualifications Required



- Fluent in English and Spanish (spoken & written)



- Minimum 1 year of relevant healthcare support experience



- Completion of at least 2 years of college education in a medical-related field



- Experience with new patient registration / appointment creation



- Experience with insurance eligibility & prior authorizations



- Knowledge of U.S. insurance types (PPO, HMO, Medicare)



- Typing speed: 45+ WPM



- Strong organizational and multitasking skills



- Excellent English communication skills



- Strong verbal and written communication abilities



- Professional communication standards must be maintained at all times



- Must be able to consistently commit to the assigned night shift schedule



- Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment



- Must have completed HIPAA Compliance Training



- Existing HIPAA Compliance Certificate required (expired certificates acceptable)



- Must provide a valid NBI Clearance (current version)



- Reliable high-speed internet connection required



- Fiber Optic or Cable Broadband connections strongly preferred



- Must have access to a desktop or laptop (Windows-based)



- Device must support multitasking, EMR systems, and real-time communications



- Quiet, professional, and distraction-free work environment required



- Workspace must be suitable for voice calls and patient communications



- Must have a reliable power and internet setup



- Backup power solutions (UPS / secondary connection) highly preferred (May not required)



- Must be comfortable participating in video meetings when required



- Strong work ethic with dependable attendance record Preferred (Not Required)



- Bachelor‚Äôs degree (2-year course plus), preferably healthcare-related



- 2 or more years of healthcare-related experience



- Experience supporting U.S. medical providers



- Experience with eClinicalWorks or similar EMR systems is plus (Not Required)



Time Zone & Performance Expectations:

- Contractors must adhere to their assigned shift based on U.S. Pacific Time (PT).



Reliability, consistency, and punctuality are essential, as this role supports active clinic operations and time-sensitive workflows.



Performance will be evaluated based on accuracy, productivity, and workflow compliance.



Continued contract engagement is subject to performance, reliability, and workflow compliance.



Compensation & Engagement Terms

title: Sales Call Quality & Performance Analyst (Remote)
description:
We are a growing Australian telehealth company generating high volumes of booked discovery calls each week.



Our revenue depends on disciplined execution:

We are hiring a Sales Call Quality & Performance Analyst to monitor, track, and report daily sales performance metrics.

This is a structured, numbers-focused quality control role. You will work directly with the founder.



Your Core Responsibility



Your job will be to ensure sales discipline and performance visibility.



You will track:



‚Ä¢ Calls booked

‚Ä¢ Calls attended (show rate)

‚Ä¢ Conversion rate

‚Ä¢ Call-on-time performance

‚Ä¢ Follow-up compliance

‚Ä¢ Cancellation and no-show trends



You will review recorded calls to ensure structure, timing, and close attempts are consistent. 



Key Responsibilities



‚Ä¢ Pull daily reports from Pipedrive and VOIP

‚Ä¢ Maintain structured KPI dashboards in Google Sheets

‚Ä¢ Monitor call-on-time ?ily

‚Ä¢ Review and score recorded discovery calls

‚Ä¢ Track 12-minute call structure adherence

‚Ä¢ Track follow-up attempts logged in CRM

‚Ä¢ Identify performance gaps

‚Ä¢ Provide clear daily summaries to leadership



This role is structured, repetitive, and metrics-driven.



Required Experience



‚Ä¢ Experience working inside a CRM (Pipedrive preferred)

‚Ä¢ Strong Google Sheets skills

‚Ä¢ Experience tracking KPIs or call centre performance

‚Ä¢ Comfortable listening to sales calls and identifying structure

‚Ä¢ Strong written English

‚Ä¢ Detail-oriented and process-driven



Preferred



‚Ä¢ Experience in call centre QA or sales operations

‚Ä¢ Experience reviewing call recordings

‚Ä¢ Experience tracking show rates or conversion metrics



Hours



40 hours per week - Australian business hours.



How to Apply

Your CV

description:

The coach helps parents learn practical skills to manage behavior challenges, reduce stress, and improve family relationships.

Main Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Comfort using virtual meeting platforms and digital tools



Education & Experience

Preferred qualifications include:



‚Ä¢ Degree or coursework in Psychology, Social Work, Counseling, or Human Services

Personal Qualities

title: Join Our Team as a Webflow Designer!
description:
Are you a talented Webflow designer looking for a long-term, flexible role with a supportive and strategy-led team? We are seeking a detail-oriented designer to help us build beautiful, high-performing websites for our clients.



This is an ongoing contract role with consistent work for the right person. We value quality and collaboration, and we‚Äôre excited to find a partner for the long run.



Why You‚Äôll Enjoy Working With Us



‚Ä¢ Clear Direction: We provide clear strategy, copy, and wireframes for every project.

‚Ä¢ Defined Scope: Each task and page has a well-defined scope to ensure clarity.

‚Ä¢ Flexible Hours: Work on your own schedule. We focus on deadlines, not fixed shifts.

‚Ä¢ Respectful Collaboration: We value open communication and feedback, and we don‚Äôt believe in last-minute changes without discussion.

‚Ä¢ Long-Term Partnership: We‚Äôre looking for a long-term collaborator to grow with us.



We care about doing things right and building websites that last. We‚Äôre not about rushing to the finish line.



What You‚Äôll Be Doing



‚Ä¢ Designing and building websites in Webflow.

‚Ä¢ (Optional) Designing in Figma before building in Webflow.

‚Ä¢ Using the Client-First style guide for clean and scalable builds. 

‚Ä¢ Building out CMS collections in a logical and organised way. 

‚Ä¢ Implementing basic SEO best practices during the build.

‚Ä¢ Following our provided strategy, copy, and wireframes.

‚Ä¢ Tidying up and improving existing Webflow sites as needed.

‚Ä¢ Delivering websites that are clean, scalable, and easy for clients to maintain.



Preferred Skills (Please Read Carefully)



Webflow

‚Ä¢ Strong experience building websites in Webflow. 

‚Ä¢ Confident with the CMS, components, and interactions.

‚Ä¢ You build clean sites. No inline styles or messy overrides.



Client-First

‚Ä¢ Confident using the Client-First naming convention and structure.

‚Ä¢ You know when to reuse vs. extend classes.

‚Ä¢ You understand how to use utility and combo classes effectively.



SEO Basics

‚Ä¢ You know how to structure headings correctly (H1, H2, H3).

‚Ä¢ You can write and implement meta titles and descriptions.

‚Ä¢ You know how to add image alt text. 

‚Ä¢ You can set up CMS-driven SEO fields.

‚Ä¢ You understand basic internal linking.



Your Working Style

‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre comfortable working independently with clear direction.

‚Ä¢ You communicate your progress and flag any issues early. 

‚Ä¢ You meet deadlines reliably.

‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre open to collaboration and feedback.

‚Ä¢ We can trust you to manage your time and workflow effectively.



Hours & Rate

‚Ä¢ Part-time, ongoing contract. 

‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours.

‚Ä¢ Work to deadlines, not set shifts.

‚Ä¢ Your hourly rate will be based on your experience.



How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:



1. A link to 2‚Äì4 live Webflow sites you personally built.

2. At least one example that uses the Client-First style guide.

3. A short explanation of how you approach SEO when building a Webflow site.

4. Your hourly rate.

5. Your weekly availability.



We‚Äôre excited to hear from you!

title: Client Success - CRM Onboarding
description:
About Broki



Broki is a modern CRM and workflow platform built specifically for mortgage brokers. We help brokers streamline their pipeline, automate communication, manage documents, and grow their business through better systems.



We are growing quickly and need someone dedicated to helping new and existing users get fully set up and confident inside the platform.



Role Overview



This is an onboarding and customer enablement role.



You will guide new users through setting up Broki properly and ensure existing users are fully utilizing the platform. You will primarily work through scheduled video calls, walking users through setup while they share their screen.



You will not handle client data.

You will not access broker files.

You will not provide compliance or mortgage advice.



Your role is purely platform guidance and user success.



What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For

1?? New User Onboarding



Reach out to every new sign-up within 24‚Äì48 hours



Book onboarding calls



Conduct structured Zoom walkthroughs



Guide users through essential setup steps:



Connecting their mortgage application platform



 integration setup



Configuring pipeline stages



Setting up document templates



Basic automation setup



Your goal is to ensure users are fully activated within their first 7‚Äì14 days.



2?? Platform Education



Teach users how Broki works



Show best-practice workflows



Help customize their pipeline to match how they run their business



Answer basic usage questions



Provide clear, simple guidance



You will receive structured training before onboarding users.



3?? User Retention & Check-Ins



Follow up with existing users



Identify users who are not fully active



Offer optimization sessions



Gather feedback for product improvements



Help prevent churn by ensuring users feel supported



4?? Internal Feedback Loop



Report recurring questions or friction points



Help improve onboarding materials



Suggest improvements to SOPs and tutorials



What Success Looks Like



High onboarding completion rate



Users connected and fully set up quickly



Strong product adoption



Low churn



Positive onboarding experience feedback



Ideal Candidate



You are:



Extremely clear and confident on video calls



Comfortable leading screen-share walkthroughs



Patient and structured in your teaching



Organized and checklist-driven



Tech-savvy and fast at learning software



Friendly and professional



Comfortable working with business owners



Experience in:



SaaS onboarding



CRM systems



Customer success



Tech support

is a strong advantage.



Mortgage industry knowledge is helpful but not required.



Why This Role Is Global



Because this role does not involve accessing user data or handling compliance-sensitive information, it is fully remote and can be performed from anywhere.



All guidance is done through video calls while users share their screen.



Growth Opportunity



As Broki scales, this role can grow into:



Head of Customer Success



Onboarding Manager



Customer Experience Lead



Training & Education Lead

title: Full-Time iOS Developer (Swift - Mobile App)
description:
HOW TO APPLY (IF YOU DO NOT DO THIS, YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED)

Please include the following in your application:



1. Link to your GitHub or code portfolio ‚Äî Show us real Swift code.

2. Link to at least one app you've built ‚Äî App Store link, TestFlight, video walkthrough, or screenshots. We want to see what you've shipped.

3. A brief note on how you use AI coding tools ‚Äî Which ones, and how they fit into your workflow. If you don't use them yet, just say so.

4. Your expected hourly rate in USD.



INTRODUCTION

We're building a mobile app that's going to change how people learn poker ‚Äî and we need a Swift developer who can ship.

Stack is a mobile-first poker education app. Think Duolingo meets 
. Bite-sized lessons, gamification, streaks, leaderboards ‚Äî all wrapped in a sleek dark UI that feels like a premium product.

The designs are coming. The content is built. We need someone who can take a PRD and polished layouts and turn them into a real, shipped iOS app ‚Äî fast.



If you're a Swift developer who moves quickly, makes smart decisions, and doesn't need hand-holding ‚Äî this might be the best role you find this year.



WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

- Build a real product from the ground up ‚Äî You're not maintaining legacy code. You're building a brand new app that a massive audience is waiting for.

- Consistent, reliable pay ‚Äî We have NEVER missed a payment. We also offer performance bonuses for exceptional work.

- Work with a growing brand ‚Äî Stack is backed 
 a poker brand with 200K+ followers on Instagram. The audience is built. The content is ready. We need the app.

- AI-forward team ‚Äî We use Claude Code, Cursor, and Codex heavily. If AI tools are already part of your workflow, you'll feel right at home.

- Room to grow ‚Äî Start with the core app build. High performers take on more ownership, architecture decisions, and leadership as we scale.

- Be treated right ‚Äî Direct access to the founders, open communication, fast feedback loops, and a team that respects your time and talent.



YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

You'll be working directly with our co-founder to build Stack's iOS app from designs and PRDs.



Primary (Day 1):

Build and ship iOS app screens from Figma designs and PRDs

Implement the core lesson/quiz engine (multiple question types, scoring, progression)

Integrate Firebase (Auth, Firestore, Storage, Messaging)

Build real-time features using WebSocket where needed

Implement push notifications and streak/engagement triggers

Write Cloud Functions for server-side logic

Handle animations, transitions, and micro-interactions that make the app feel polished

Make smart calls on edge cases, error states, and UX polish without being told every detail



As You Grow:



Contribute to architecture decisions and technical planning

Optimize performance and app size

Implement analytics and tracking

App Store submission and release management

Help onboard additional developers as the team grows





ABOUT US

Stack ‚Äî A mobile-first poker training app that combines Duolingo-style daily learning with competitive gamification. 5 courses, 44 lessons, 475+ questions ‚Äî all designed and ready to build. We need the engineering to match the 
 ‚Äî A poker education and entertainment brand with 200K+ followers on Instagram. The audience is real. The demand is real. We just need to ship.

We're a small, fast-moving team. No bureaucracy, no pointless meetings, no Jira tickets for the sake of Jira tickets. You'll get clear direction, good designs, and the freedom to build.



REQUIREMENTS

Must-Haves:

Swift is your primary language ‚Äî This is non-negotiable. We need someone who dreams in Swift, not someone who "can also do iOS."

Experience shipping iOS apps ‚Äî You've built apps that real people use. Show us what you've shipped.

Firebase proficiency ‚Äî Auth, Firestore, Storage, Cloud Functions, Messaging. You've worked with this stack before.

You ship fast and make good decisions ‚Äî You'll get a PRD and designs. Your job is to build it, handle the details, and get it done without a lot of hand-holding.

Comfort with AI coding tools ‚Äî We use Claude Code, Cursor, and Codex daily. If these are already in your workflow, perfect. If not, you need to be eager to adopt them.

Fluent, excellent written English ‚Äî You'll be communicating directly with the co-founder daily.

Full-time availability (40 hrs/week) and available for regular check-ins

Reliable high-speed internet

A video call will be part of the interview process



Bonus (Not Required):



Experience with WebSocket / real-time features

Published apps on the App Store

Experience with gamification mechanics (progress systems, streaks, lives/hearts)

Animation skills (Lottie, SwiftUI animations)

Experience working with small startups or as a solo developer



Applications without a code sample or portfolio will not be considered. Show us what you've built.

Ship it. ????

title: Strategic Operations Leader ‚Äì STR/LTR Portfolio (High-Performance Lead for Pooling)

We have a solid team of remote guest support, but we are currently missing a results-driven leader to unify them. We don‚Äôt need a "boss" to watch the clock; we need a high-level operator who can walk into a workflow, identify bottlenecks, and execute solutions immediately.

mbers to take more initiative.

Zero-Tolerance for Misses: Take full ownership of guest satisfaction. If there‚Äôs an attendance or performance "miss," you diagnose the root cause and fix it‚Äîperiod.

KPI Mastery: Track, analyze, and pivot based on data. If the numbers aren't moving, you find the "why" and implement the "how."

What You Bring

AI Proficiency: You use ChatGPT or similar tools to generate high-quality content, reports, and responses at 10x speed.

The Package

.

title: Data Entry/ Data Processing Specialist (Job Ref: STRT-DE-38808)
description:
Company Overview



StrataWorks is a leading provider of digital consulting and operational solutions. We assist businesses in optimizing workflows, managing data, and improving operational efficiency. Our clients range from startups to established enterprises, and our team is dedicated to delivering accurate, timely, and high-quality operational support.



Position Summary



StrataWorks is seeking a Data Entry / Data Processing Specialist to support the management and maintenance of information across internal systems. This position is critical for ensuring the accuracy, organization, and reliability of data used in decision-making and operational processes.



This is a support role focused on precision and consistency. Technical expertise beyond basic data handling is not required.



Key Responsibilities



Enter, update, and organize data in spreadsheets, databases, and internal platforms



Verify data accuracy and completeness



Conduct online research to gather relevant information for projects



Prepare basic reports and maintain documentation

title: Senior U.S. Restaurant Accountant ‚Äì QuickBooks Online (Full-Time, USA State of Illinois Clients)
description:
?



Senior U.S. Restaurant Accountant (Full-Time ‚Äì 45 hrs/week, No Weekends)



We are a multi-location restaurant group based in Illinois, USA.



We are hiring a Senior U.S. Accountant / CPA with strong restaurant accounting experience.



This is NOT a bookkeeping position.

This is a financial control role.



If you need training, do NOT apply.

If you already understand U.S. accounting and restaurant financials, apply.



?



Schedule



‚Ä¢ 45 hours per week

‚Ä¢ Monday‚ÄìFriday only

‚Ä¢ Must overlap with U.S. CST time zone

‚Ä¢ No weekend work



?



Compensation



Starting salary: $1,200 USD per month starting salary-



After 90 days, compensation will be reviewed based strictly on performance, accuracy, and execution.



Do not apply if you are not comfortable starting at $1,200/month.



?



Required Experience (Do Not Apply If You Don‚Äôt Meet These)



‚Ä¢ 5+ years handling U.S.-based companies

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of U.S. GAAP

‚Ä¢ Illinois sales tax filing experience (state + local)

‚Ä¢ Advanced QuickBooks Online (Intuit QB)

‚Ä¢ Multi-location accounting experience

‚Ä¢ Restaurant accounting REQUIRED

‚Ä¢ Monthly close experience

‚Ä¢ Bank and merchant reconciliations

‚Ä¢ Balance sheet cleanup experience



?



Responsibilities



‚Ä¢ Prepare monthly P&L for each restaurant location

‚Ä¢ Reconcile all bank and merchant accounts monthly

‚Ä¢ Review food cost %, labor %, operating expenses

‚Ä¢ File Illinois state and local sales taxes

‚Ä¢ Maintain clean balance sheets

‚Ä¢ Eliminate clearing and suspense accounts

‚Ä¢ Identify errors and correct them

‚Ä¢ Provide financial explanations, not just numbers



?



BEFORE INTERVIEW ‚Äì MANDATORY TECHNICAL QUESTIONS



You MUST answer the following in detail.

Short or vague answers = automatic rejection.



?



SECTION 1 ‚Äì Journal Entries

 1. How would you record $170,000 in restaurant food sales where $150,000 is credit card and $20,000 is cash? Include sales tax in your explanation.

 2. How would you record $6,900 in merchant processing fees?

 3. How would you record a $3,000 Illinois sales tax payment?



?



SECTION 2 ‚Äì Reconciliation Logic

 4. Merchant deposits total $198,000.

POS sales show $173,500.

Explain step-by-step how you reconcile this difference.

 5. If payroll clearing does not zero at month-end, what does that indicate?

 6. If Sales Tax Payable becomes negative, what caused it and how do you fix it?



?



SECTION 3 ‚Äì Restaurant Metrics

 7. What is an acceptable labor % in a full-service breakfast restaurant?

 8. What is an acceptable food cost %?

 9. If labor increases from 28% to 36%, what operational problems might exist?



?



SECTION 4 ‚Äì Balance Sheet Control

 10. What documentation must exist for intercompany loans?

 11. What documentation must exist for a shareholder loan?

 12. What does a suspense account balance usually indicate?



?



SECTION 5 ‚Äì Experience Verification

 13. How many U.S. companies have you handled?

 14. Have you filed Illinois sales tax before? Explain the process.

 15. How many restaurant clients have you worked with?

 16. What was the largest annual revenue client you managed?

 17. Are you a licensed CPA? If yes, where?

 18. Confirm you can work 45 hours per week, Monday‚ÄìFriday.



?



Applicants who do not provide structured, detailed answers will not be considered.



We are looking for a serious, experienced U.S.-focused restaurant accountant.

title: Google Ads + YouTube Ads Specialist (Coaching/Service Business) ‚Äî 10hr Audit/Fix + 1hr/week Maintenance
description:
I‚Äôm looking for a hands-on Google Ads specialist with strong experience in service businesses / coaching funnels to do a short, focused mission:



~10 hours total to audit + fix tracking + stabilize CPL + clean up account structure



then 1 hour/week ongoing maintenance (reporting + optimizations + testing plan)



This is for SOLV Languages, a French coaching business. Our focus is ‚Äúautonomy-first, conversation-focused learning.‚Äù Core offer: 30/90 Program. The funnel is ads ? lead/booking ? call ? sale.



What I need help with (current issues)



CPL increased a lot after running the same ad angle for too long (likely fatigue / audience saturation / structure issues).



I launched a new very targeted campaign (50+ rural expats in France) and changed conversion tracking‚Ä¶ now I‚Äôm seeing almost no conversions after a few days and I‚Äôm worried tracking or optimization is wrong.



I‚Äôm not confident the tracking is reliable (GA4/GTM/Google Ads conversions/attribution). I need a clean, simple setup and clarity on what to optimize for.



I‚Äôm considering adding Meta later, but right now I need a strong Google Ads foundation.



Main goal



Get to a reliable, measurable lead-gen system with stable CPL and clear next steps for scaling.



Scope of the 10-hour mission (deliverables)



By the end of the mission, you‚Äôll deliver:



1) Tracking & Conversion Audit (must-have)



Review Google Ads conversion actions, GA4, GTM, and booking flow



Confirm conversions fire correctly (tests + sanity checks)



Fix or recommend the right conversion hierarchy (primary vs secondary)



Make sure we‚Äôre not starving the algo with a conversion that‚Äôs too rare



2) Account & Campaign Structure Cleanup



Diagnose what caused the CPL spike (fatigue, targeting, learning limits, bidding, budget spread, keyword match types, negatives, etc.)



Recommend and implement a clean structure (Search + YouTube where relevant)



Ensure the account is easy to optimize moving forward (not overly complex)



3) Optimization Plan (simple and actionable)



What to pause / keep / rebuild



What tests to run first (ads, audiences, offers, landing page hooks)



A short roadmap for the next 2‚Äì4 weeks



4) A short written report + Loom walkthrough



1‚Äì2 pages max (or a clear Notion doc)



Loom video explaining changes, why, and what you‚Äôll do next



Ongoing maintenance (1 hour/week)



Weekly check: budgets, search terms, negatives, placements, bid strategy, ad performance



3‚Äì5 bullet update: what happened, what you changed, what we‚Äôll test next



Keep tracking healthy and performance stable



Platforms / skills required



Must have:



Google Ads (Search + YouTube) lead-gen for service businesses/coaching



Strong tracking: GA4 + GTM + conversion setup & troubleshooting



Ability to explain clearly and keep things simple



Nice to have:



Experience with booking funnels (Calendly / appointment systems)



Landing page optimization instincts



Meta ads perspective (optional)



What I‚Äôm looking for (non-negotiables)



You‚Äôve run Google Ads for online services/coaching (not only ecommerce)



You know how to make YouTube ads work for lead-gen (not just awareness)



You can identify signal vs noise fast and move confidently



You‚Äôre policy-compliant and don‚Äôt use shady hacks



To apply (please answer these)



What‚Äôs your experience with coaching/service businesses and lead-gen funnels? Share 1‚Äì2 examples (numbers are welcome).



What‚Äôs your approach to YouTube ads for leads? (targeting + creative + conversion strategy)



How do you decide which conversion to optimize for when booked calls are low volume?



What would you do in the first 2 hours inside my account?



Your availability: can you start this week?



Budget / working style



Initial mission: ~10 hours (fixed scope, outcome-focused)



Ongoing: 1 hour/week

title: Guest Support for Short Term Rental Company
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

We are seeking a Guest Support & Operations Analyst to manage overnight guest communications and support key backend operations. This role combines guest relations, reservation management, and administrative tasks to ensure seamless service and operational accuracy.



IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT THIS ROLE

- This is NOT a generic support role.

- You‚Äôll be juggling guests, cleaners, and maintenance teams in real time ‚Äî often with imperfect information and real consequences if poor decisions are made. Because of that, our hiring process is intentionally more challenging than a typical ‚Äúmessage responder‚Äù position.

- The assessment you‚Äôre about to take is designed to understand how you think ‚Äî how you prioritize, communicate, and make judgment calls when there isn‚Äôt one obvious right answer.

- If you enjoy solving realistic scenarios, thinking critically, and taking ownership, you will likely enjoy both this assessment and the job itself. If you are looking for a simple, scripted support role, this probably won‚Äôt be the right fit ‚Äî and that‚Äôs okay.

Guest Communications & Support

- Respond promptly and professionally to booking inquiries, guest messages, and support requests across multiple platforms.

- Collaborate with the operations team to facilitate smooth check-ins, check-outs, and overall guest satisfaction.

Qualifications

, Vrbo, etc.).

We‚Äôre looking for a tech-savvy, detail-obsessed Senior Accountant to support our U.S.-based clients ‚Äî mainly in the trades and construction industries. You will be the right-hand person for business owners who rely on clean books and meaningful financial reports to drive smart decisions.



This role is ideal for someone with a strong U.S. accounting background, a QBO ProAdvisor certification, and experience managing multiple client accounts. If you love spreadsheets, job costing, and solving problems before they become issues ‚Äî this is for you.



Key Responsibilities

You‚Äôll Succeed If You Have:

title: Senior Web Developer (Part-Time)
description:
About YSS Media

YSS Media is an Australian company operating in the hair and beauty industry across three divisions: a B2B SaaS loyalty platform (Hair Clubs by YSS), a creative agency for beauty brands (YSS Agency), and a podcast/media platform (Can We Go Live). We work with major brands and premium salons, and our philosophy is simple: don't be boring. Everything we produce from code to creative needs to meet a premium standard.

We're a small, tight team that moves fast. You'll be working directly with the founder (who has a technical background in software engineering) and alongside our Ops & Automation Engineer and Art Director.



The Role

We're looking for a senior web developer with strong design sensibility to own our web properties - primarily client websites on WordPress and Shopify, and Framer.



This is not a pure execution role. We need someone who can look at a design and implement it perfectly, but also someone who can take a rough brief and build something that looks and feels premium without needing their hand held. You should be as comfortable in PHP and server config as you are in CSS and animations.



You'll start part time (30 hours/week). For the right person, this role grows into a technical full time lead position. This is someone who doesn't just build, but thinks architecturally, contributes to infrastructure decisions, and becomes a true engineering partner.



What You'll Be Doing

Core Responsibilities (Day One)

Frontend & Design Implementation



Implementing designs from our Art Director, translating Figma/design files into responsive websites

Frontend animations and interactions, CSS animations, GSAP, scroll effects, loaders. The details that make a site feel premium

Maintaining visual consistency and premium quality across all web properties



WordPress Development

Theme development, ACF flexible content, custom blocks, page templates

We need modular, reusable architecture

PHP backend logic custom functions, hooks, filters, REST API endpoints

Security hardening SSL management, malware scanning, vulnerability patching, keeping WordPress core and plugins secure



Shopify Development

Liquid templates, theme customisation, section architecture

Frontend polish and theme modifications



Framer

Marketing pages, landing pages, interactive components



Server & Hosting

Managing hosting environments, staging sites, DNS configuration

Server troubleshooting and performance issues

Deployments and environment management



Analytics & Tracking

GA4, Google Tag Manager, conversion pixels setup and maintenance

Ensuring tracking is accurate and properly configured across client sites





Performance Optimisation

Page speed, caching strategies, CDN configuration

Core Web Vitals and overall site performance



API Integrations

Third party service integrations and webhooks

Building and maintaining connections between platforms



Growth Responsibilities (As You Develop) 

Contributing to technical architecture decisions across YSS, including our SaaS platform (Hair Clubs)

Solutions architecture,  evaluating approaches, identifying trade offs, making recommendations

Helping shape engineering processes and standards across the team

Mentoring and collaborating with our automation engineer on cross functional projects

Occasionally handling client communication on technical matters when needed





What We're Looking For

Must Haves



5+ years web development experience across WordPress and Shopify

Strong design sensibility, you understand typography, spacing, visual hierarchy, and colour. You don't just build what you're told; you notice when something looks off and fix it

WordPress expertise, custom theme development, ACF (Advanced Custom Fields), flexible content, custom blocks, PHP templating. You build modular, reusable components not one off sections that can't be repurposed

PHP proficiency comfortable writing custom backend logic, not just installing plugins

Shopify Liquid comfortable with theme architecture, sections, templates

Modern CSS/SCSS responsive design, animations, transitions, grid, flexbox

JavaScript vanilla JS, DOM manipulation, some framework experience is a plus

Server management comfortable with hosting environments, SSH, staging setups, DNS, basic server troubleshooting

Security awareness SSL, WordPress hardening, malware scanning, keeping things locked down

Git proficiency branching, merging, pull requests, code review. Not just committing to main

AI coding tools this is critical. We expect you to use Claude Code, Cursor, or similar AI tools daily. Not as a crutch, but as a force multiplier. If you're not already using AI in your development workflow, this isn't the right fit

Documentation habits you write code comments, maintain READMEs, and document architecture decisions. We never want to be in a position where only you understand how something is built

Independence you can take a brief, ask smart questions, and deliver without constant oversight

Attention to detail pixel level precision on implementation. If the design says 24px padding, it's 24px padding



Nice-to-Haves



Framer experience

GSAP / animation libraries

GA4 and Google Tag Manager setup experience

Klaviyo or similar
 platform experience

Performance optimisation (Core Web Vitals, caching, CDN)

API integration experience (REST APIs, webhooks)

CI/CD and deployment pipeline experience

Experience with headless CMS setups

Understanding of SEO best practices

Agile thinking you understand iterative development, not just waterfall task execution

Coaching tea
mbers



How You'll Work



Embedded in the team ‚Äî you'll be on Slack, standups and all tea
etings

Timezone overlap with Sydney - you work from 11am Sydney time year round

Direct communication - you'll work directly with the founder and Art Director, not through a project manager or ticketing black box

Structured engineering practices ‚Äî we're building proper Git workflows, PR processes, and code review practices together. You'll have input into how we set these up





Our Standards

We're moving away from an external agency because their output consistently didn't meet our standards. To be direct about what that means:



A page duplication with copy and image swaps should take 2‚Äì3 hours, not 20

A loading animation should actually loop until the page is ready, not play once and show a black screen

If you're building ACF sections, they should be modular enough to reuse across pages without rebuilding from scratch every time

Code should be clean, commented, documented, and structured ‚Äî not 150 lines of inline CSS with no explanation

If something will take longer than expected, we want to know upfront with a clear explanation ‚Äî not a post-hoc justification

Every project should have a README. Every architectural decision should be documented. We will never again be in a position where only one person or team understands how something works



We're not unreasonable. We understand complexity. But we don't accept padded hours or sloppy architecture.



Compensation & Growth



Starting: Part-time (30 hours/week)

Growth path: Full-time as revenue scales, with compensation growth to match

Long-term: For the right person, this evolves into a technical lead role with broader architectural responsibility and compensation that reflects it

Payment: Monthly, USD





How to Apply

Don't send a generic cover letter. Instead, send us:

Your portfolio 

Loom video introduction





Location

Philippines based candidates only.
