title: Junior Developer / AI-Assisted Tech Builder
description:
**Company:** US Vacation Rental Tech Company

**Type:** Part-time, Remote (20-40 hrs/week depending on performance and availability -

**Rate:** $4-5/hr USD (with raises based on performance)



---



## About Us



We're a small but growing US-based property management company running 17+ vacation rental units. We use technology heavily to automate our operations and are looking for a smart, motivated developer to help us build and expand our automation systems.



## The Role



We need a sharp, resourceful junior developer who is comfortable using AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor, Claude Code) to build real, working solutions. **You don't need to be a senior engineer.** You need to be intelligent, honest, and relentless about figuring things out.



You'll be integrating multiple business platforms via their APIs into a centralized data system, building automation workflows, and growing into more advanced AI projects over time.



**This is NOT a role for someone who wants to bill hours and drag projects out.** We want someone who takes ownership, moves fast, delivers results, and charges fairly.



## What You'll Do



- Connect APIs (Gmail, Hostaway, OpenPhone, (Quo) 
) into a centralized data system (MCP architecture)

- Use Claude, Claude Code, and other AI tools as your daily co-pilot to write, debug, and ship code

- Build simple but functional automation pipelines that process data across platforms

- Communicate progress clearly, ask good questions when stuck, and document your work

- Grow into more advanced projects: voice AI (ElevenLabs), video AI (HeyGen), guest-facing interfaces



## What We're Looking For



**Must-Have:**

- High problem-solving ability ‚Äî you figure things out, you don't give up easily

- Basic comfort with Python or JavaScript (you don't need to be an expert)

- Already using AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor, etc.) to code and learn faster

- Honest, reliable, responsive communication (we use async communication heavily)

- You'd rather ship something that works than overthink it

- Strong English communication skills (written)

- Available 20-40 hours per week with consistent schedule



**Nice-to-Have:**

- Familiarity with REST APIs and webhooks

- Experience with 
, n8n, or Zapier

- Familiarity with Git/GitHub



**What Does NOT Matter:**

- Years of experience

- Computer Science degree

- Having used these specific APIs before

- Your age (we care about ability, not credentials)



## What We Offer



- a posibility of  long-term part-time work with a fair employer

- Access to Claude Pro and AI development tools (we pay for your tools)

- Real projects that ship ‚Äî not busywork

- Opportunity to grow your skills on interesting AI/automation projects

- Direct communication with the founder (no corporate bureaucracy)



## Minimum Requirements to Apply



**You MUST meet ALL of the following to be considered. Applications missing any of these will be ignored.**



### 1. Proof of a Working Project



You must share a link to at least ONE project you have built that involves code. This can be:

- A GitHub, GitLab, or Replit link

- A CodePen or CodeSandbox link

- A deployed app or website you built

- A Google Drive link to a project folder with source code



The project does NOT need to be complex. It could be a simple automation script, a web scraper, a basic web app, a bot, a data tool ‚Äî anything. But it must be real code that you wrote (with or without AI assistance), and you must be able to explain it.



**No link = no consideration. No exceptions.** 



### 2. Demonstrate AI Tool Usage



Record a short Loom video (2-3 minutes max) showing:



- You opening Claude.ai (free version is fine) or ChatGPT

- You giving it a coding prompt related to an API integration (any API)

- You explaining what the AI gave you, what's correct, and what you would fix or improve



This shows me you actually use AI tools and understand what the code does ‚Äî not just copy-paste blindly.



**No Loom video = no consideration.**



### 3. Written Application Answers



Answer ALL of these questions in your application:



**A)** What programming language(s) are you most comfortable with? Rate yourself 1-10 for each and be honest ‚Äî I respect honesty more than inflated numbers.



**B)** Have you ever connected to a REST API? If yes, which one(s) and what did you do with the data? If no, that's okay ‚Äî describe how you would approach it for the first time.



**C)** What is your hourly rate expectation in USD? How many hours per week are you available, and what hours/time zone do you work in?



**D)** Why do you want this role specifically? (2-3 sentences ‚Äî I can spot copy-paste answers.)



---



Your application must include,



Link to at least one code project you built

Loom video showing you using an AI coding tool (2-3 min)

Written answers to questions A, B, C, and D above



**Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.** I know this is a lot to ask ‚Äî that's intentional. If you take the time to do this, you're already ahead of 90% of applicants.

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Day Shift
description:
We‚Äôre hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



‚Äî-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those ‚Äúmagic 
nts‚Äù where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does‚Äîevery time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Short Form Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Financial Accountant

title: Accounting/CFO
description:
Job Description:



We are seeking a highly skilled CPA Accountant / CFO to oversee the financial strategy, accounting operations, and compliance for a multi-location restaurant group. This leadership role demands a hands-on professional who can manage the full financial picture‚Äîdaily, weekly, and monthly‚Äîwhile also supporting long-term planning, audits, and investor reporting.



Responsibilities:

 ‚Ä¢ Oversee all accounting functions, including general ledger, AP/AR, payroll review, bank reconciliations, and month-end close

 ‚Ä¢ Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial statements and balance sheets across all locations

 ‚Ä¢ Monitor daily cash flow and vendor payments to ensure financial discipline

 ‚Ä¢ Lead the budgeting and forecasting process for each unit and consolidate group-level projections

 ‚Ä¢ Prepare weekly and monthly P&Ls and compare against budgeted performance

 ‚Ä¢ Identify and reduce unnecessary expenses; track food, labor, and operational cost drivers

 ‚Ä¢ Ensure timely and accurate tax filings (payroll, sales, income) and maintain compliance with local, state, and federal agencies

 ‚Ä¢ Manage relationships with external tax advisors, banks, and auditors

 ‚Ä¢ Supervise or collaborate with in-house accounting staff and provide clear task delegation

 ‚Ä¢ Support financial modeling for expansion, investment, or potential asset sales

 ‚Ä¢ Provide strategic recommendations to ownership based on data-driven financial insights

 ‚Ä¢ Maintain internal controls and accounting policies that align with GAAP standards



Daily Expectations:

 ‚Ä¢ Check daily sales reports and verify deposits across all locations

 ‚Ä¢ Monitor bill payments, cash outflows, and reconcile bank accounts

 ‚Ä¢ Review payroll summaries and flag any discrepancies

 ‚Ä¢ Communicate with store managers or office staff to resolve any financial issues

 ‚Ä¢ Track outstanding receivables, vendor balances, and lease obligations

 ‚Ä¢ Update owner with a quick daily summary on cash position, red flags, and wins



Qualifications:

 ‚Ä¢ Active CPA license required

 ‚Ä¢ 7+ years of accounting and financial leadership experience, preferably in multi-unit restaurant or hospitality businesses

 ‚Ä¢ Strong grasp of GAAP, tax regulations, and restaurant-specific accounting (e.g., prime cost control, inventory tracking, COGS)

 ‚Ä¢ Proficiency in QuickBooks, Excel, and restaurant software systems

 ‚Ä¢ Exceptional organization, communication, and leadership skills

 ‚Ä¢ Strategic thinker with the ability to execute quickly and accurately

- Personal Assistant / Video Admin & Outreach



- Food Reels Editor (short?form vertical videos)



Please read both roles below and tell me which position you‚Äôre applying for.



1) Personal Assistant / Video Admin & Outreach

You‚Äôll help with personal admin, creative business tasks, and keeping our restaurant content and video projects organized. This is mostly admin, research, light marketing, and organization work.



Typical tasks:



- Research and build lists of potential business leads (restaurants and other local brands) with contact info.

- Send and track outreach
s/DMs using templates I provide.

- Organize leads in a simple CRM or Google Sheet (status, last contact date, notes).

- Help with scheduling: confirmations, reminders, and simple ‚Äúproject / shoot sheet‚Äù details.

- Organize client folders, project files, and portfolio examples in shared drives.

- Help maintain a simple social media posting schedule using our content and voice.

- Light admin support for ongoing video projects (updating trackers, statuses, notes, due dates).



You‚Äôre a good fit if:



- You have strong written English and can follow detailed instructions.

- You enjoy organized, systems?based work (research, updating sheets, tracking details).

- You‚Äôre proactive, ask questions when unsure, and care about accuracy and deadlines.



When you reply for this role, use the subject line:

‚ÄúPersonal Assistant / Video Admin ‚Äì [Your Name]‚Äù

__________________________________________________________________________



2) Food Reels Editor (Short?Form Vertical Video)

You‚Äôll edit short?form food and brand content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.



Typical tasks:



- Edit high quality vertical videos (9:16) for IG Reels/TikTok/Shorts.

- Add music, text, hooks, and pacing suitable for social media.

- Follow a basic brand style and adjust based on feedback.



You‚Äôre a good fit if:



- You have strong experience editing short?form content (please send examples).

- You understand hooks, pacing, and storytelling for Reels/TikTok.

- You‚Äôre comfortable working with shared drives and following naming conventions.



When you reply for this role, use the subject line:

‚ÄúFood Reels Editor ‚Äì [Your Name]‚Äù



How to Apply

Please send an
 to: [YOUR
 HERE]



Include:



Which position you are applying for (or if you‚Äôre open to both).

A short introduction (who you are, where in the Philippines you‚Äôre based, your availability).



- For Personal Assistant / Video Admin & Outreach: any experience with research, outreach, or admin work.

title: Bookkeeping + Admin + Social Media (QuickBooks Online) ‚Äî Part-Time
description:
Title:

Bookkeeping + Admin + Social Media (QuickBooks Online) ‚Äî Part-Time



Job Type:

Part-time (4 hours/day) ‚Äî 20 hours/week (potential to grow)



Pay:

$3‚Äì$5/hour (depending on experience)

Paid trial: 1 week



Schedule:

Preferred overlap with U.S. Eastern Time: 10am‚Äì2pm ET (flexible if you respond fast)



About Us:

We are a U.S. accounting firm (est. 2017) located in Boston, Massachusetts. We help individuals, small business owners, and real estate investors with tax prep, bookkeeping, and payroll.



What You Will Do (No phone calls to start):



BOOKKEEPING (Primary)

- Categorize bank/credit card transactions in QuickBooks Online (QBO) and Excel

- Monthly bank + credit card reconciliation

- Identify transfers vs. expenses (no guessing; flag ‚ÄúREVIEW‚Äù)

- Basic cleanup and simple reports support (P&L notes)



CLIENT FOLLOW-UP + ADMIN (Required)

- Follow up with clients for missing documents (W-2, 1099, bank statements, etc.)

- Send reminders for monthly bank statements for bookkeeping clients

- Follow up to collect sales tax reports and confirm filing deadlines (monthly/quarterly)

- Help clients upload documents through secure portal / Client Hub

- Update client status tracker (Google Sheet/Excel)

- Organize documents and notes (Google Drive)



SOCIAL MEDIA (Light / Secondary)

- Social media is light and template-based (we provide branding, logo, colors, and examples)

- Create and schedule posts for
, Instagram, TikTok, and Google Business Profile

- Repurpose content across platforms (same post, adjusted format)

- Turn my notes into short captions/posts when needed



Weekly Targets (Example)

- Bookkeeping: keep monthly reconciliations current

- Admin: follow up daily and keep tracker updated

- Social: 2‚Äì3 posts/week using our templates (repurpose across platforms)



Requirements:

- QuickBooks Online experience (reconciliation + categorization)

- Strong written English (Chinese Mandarin/Cantonese is a plus)

- Canva experience (basic graphics, resizing, templates)

- Organized, detail-oriented, and fast communicator

- Comfortable with Microsoft Suite and MS Teams

- Stable internet + computer



Nice to Have:

- CapCut / short video editing (Reels/TikTok style)

- Experience with accounting/tax firms or small business clients

- Basic SEO knowledge (local keywords)



How to Apply (OnlineJobs.ph):

1) Send your resume

2) Include your weekly availability (in U.S. Eastern Time)

3) Answer these questions:

   Q1: How many QBO clients have you handled end-to-end (categorization + reconciliation)?

   Q2: Which industries have you worked with (construction, restaurants, etc.)?

   Q3: Share 2‚Äì3 social posts you‚Äôve created (links or screenshots).

   Q4: What tools do you use (Canva, CapCut, Buffer/Later, Google Drive, etc.)?

   Q5: What is your expected hourly rate?

   Q6: Do you have experience doing client follow-ups 
/text) and tracking status in a spreadsheet? Briefly explain.



Shortlisted candidates will take a short skills test and a paid 1-week trial.

title: Video Editor & Image Designer
description:
ABOUT US 

We are a fast-growing DTC skincare eCommerce brand. We are looking for a long-term tea
mber, not a freelancer, who wants to build a stable career with us.



We believe in empowering our team. You will get access (and training!) on premium AI tools like Higgsfield, Gemini, and ChatGPT to make your workflow faster and more creative.



WHO YOU ARE 

We are looking for a "preditor" (Producer/Editor)‚Äîsomeone who understands storytelling, pacing, and marketing, not just button-pushing.



- You possess a "student mindset": You take feedback well, you don't take critiques personally, and you improve quickly. We are looking for someone who wants to learn and grow, not someone who thinks they already know everything.

- You are efficient: You can edit a high-quality 60-second video in 2-3 hours and create a social graphic in 1-2 hours without sacrificing quality.

- You are detail-oriented: You have 0% tolerance for typos in captions and overlays.

- You are tech-savvy: You are excited to use AI to generate ideas and speed up your work.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

- Short-Form Video: Edit engaging Reels, Shorts, and TikToks (15‚Äì90 seconds) focused on UGC, products, and trends.

- Long-Form Video: Edit YouTube videos, and VSLs (5+ minutes) with clean pacing and storytelling.

- Engagement: Add animated captions, text callouts, B-roll, and visual hooks to keep retention high.

- Graphic Design: Create static ad creatives, quote cards, thumbnails, and simple motion ads.

- Photo Editing: Retouch, resize, and clean up product/lifestyle images.

- Copywriting: Write and polish short English hooks/headlines for your videos and ads.



TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS (Must Have)

- Computer Specs: You must have a PC capable of editing 4K footage and running Adobe Premiere Pro/After Effects without lag or crashing. (Recommended: 16GB+ RAM, SSD Storage).

- Internet Connection: You must have a reliable, high-speed internet connection (Fiber preferred). You will be required to download and upload large batches of raw 4K video files from Google Drive daily.

- Software: Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro (preferred), CapCut, or Final Cut + Canva/Photoshop/Figma or equivalent.



WHY JOIN US? 

- Day Shift Schedule: Enjoy your evenings and weekends! Work normal PH business hours. 

- AI Training: We pay for the tools and teach you how to use them. 

- Stability: We are looking for a partner for the long haul. 

- Portfolio: Build a portfolio with a professional beauty brand.



Schedule & Pay:

- Mon‚ÄìFri, 9:00 AM‚Äì6:00 PM Philippine time

- $600/month



HOW TO APPLY (Read Carefully) 

To ensure you are paying attention to detail, applications that do not follow these steps will be ignored.



Please reply to this job post with the subject line: "Creative Editor - [Your Name]" and include the following:

- Your video introduction.

- Your Portfolio: A link to your best work. Please highlight Short-Form Videos (TikTok/Reels).

- Your updated resume.



Hiring Process:

1. Submit Application

2. Shortlisted candidates do a simple creative test

3. Short video interview

4. Job Offer



We look forward to meeting you!

title: AI Operator
description:
Primary Responsibilities



Develop and implement effective sales processes and workflows.



What this role actually is:



Systems architect, not task manager. You design operational infrastructure that scales.



Project owner, not coordinator. You take fuzzy problems and turn them into functioning systems without hand-holding.



Builder, not executor. You implement automations, iterate on workflows, and create leverage through technology.



Problem solver, not assistant. You identify bottlenecks and engineer solutions that compound over time.



You should be fluent in AI tools (not just familiar, fluent). You should think in systems, feedback loops, and automation-first design. You should be able to take a 30-minute conversation and walk away with a blueprint that didn't exist before.



This is the wrong role for you if:



You're looking for a traditional VA or admin support position



You need detailed instruction to execute



You think of yourself as "helping with tasks"



You're not deeply embedded in AI-native workflows already



This is the right role for you if:



You've built operational systems from zero before



You default to "how can this run without me" instead of "how do I do this faster"



You can translate ambiguous strategy into concrete architecture



You view AI as infrastructure, not a productivity hack



You've designed and implemented automations that eliminated entire categories of work



?What we're looking for:



Proven ability to own and ship projects independently. Show us what you've built.



Deep fluency with AI tools and automation platforms (we want to see your stack)



Systems thinking and operational design experience



Track record of creating leverage, not just completing work



Ability to work in ambiguity and create structure where none exists.



Job Type: Full-time



Work Set-up: Remote

title: IT Support Specialist, Tier 2+ (VoIP & MSP):
description:
Who We Are:

We are a fast-growing Hawaii-based IT and VoIP provider supporting small and mid-sized businesses across multiple industries. 



We are growing and looking for a technically strong Tier 2 IT Support Specialist who can troubleshoot independently and communicate clearly with business clients.



This is not an entry-level help desk position.



Role Overview:



You will support clients in Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, networking, cybersecurity, and VoIP systems. This role involves direct client interaction, remote troubleshooting, and working across cloud, desktop, and network environments.



We are looking for someone who can think critically, troubleshoot independently, and communicate clearly.



Required Soft Skills

 ‚Ä¢ Strong written and spoken professional English

 ‚Ä¢ Comfortable speaking directly with business owners and end users

 ‚Ä¢ Self-starter who takes ownership of issues

 ‚Ä¢ Calm under pressure

 ‚Ä¢ Able to manage multiple tickets and priorities

 ‚Ä¢ Available to work Hawaii business hours



Core Responsibilities

 ‚Ä¢ Support and administer Microsoft 365 & Google Workspace

 ‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot login, authentication, and access issues

 ‚Ä¢ Configure and support VPN solutions

 ‚Ä¢ Diagnose and resolve network connectivity problems

 ‚Ä¢ Support Windows (10/11) and macOS environments

 ‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot printers, scanners, and peripherals

 ‚Ä¢ Monitor and maintain backup systems

 ‚Ä¢ Support VoIP systems (FreePBX, Grandstream)

 ‚Ä¢ Assist with server administration and Active Directory

 ‚Ä¢ Maintain documentation and ticket notes

 ‚Ä¢ Deliver dependable, professional client communication



Required Technical Experience

Candidate will possess most or all of these skills:



MSP Environment Experience (2+ years preferred)

 ‚Ä¢ Remote troubleshooting

 ‚Ä¢ Ticket-based support workflows

 ‚Ä¢ Client-facing support



Microsoft & Collaboration

 ‚Ä¢ Microsoft 365 Global Admin

 ‚Ä¢ Exchange Online

 ‚Ä¢ SharePoint / OneDrive

 ‚Ä¢ Teams

 ‚Ä¢ Google Workspace Admin



Networking

 ‚Ä¢ TCP/IP fundamentals

 ‚Ä¢ DNS & DHCP troubleshooting

 ‚Ä¢ Firewall basics

 ‚Ä¢ UniFi management experience preferred



Security & Endpoint Management

 ‚Ä¢ Endpoint protection platforms (e.g., ThreatDown, Malwarebytes, etc.)

 ‚Ä¢ RMM tools (Datto RMM preferred)

 ‚Ä¢ Patch management systems



Backup & Recovery

 ‚Ä¢ Synology NAS

 ‚Ä¢ Datto or similar BDR platforms



***



Additional Skills to Be Considered:



VoIP & Telecom (Strong Plus)

Cloud & Infrastructure (Nice to Have)

Security & Compliance (Nice to Have)

What Success Looks Like

 ‚Ä¢ Tickets resolved efficiently and documented clearly

 ‚Ä¢ Clients feel confident and supported

 ‚Ä¢ Proactive issue identification

 ‚Ä¢ Minimal escalations

 ‚Ä¢ Strong ownership of assigned accounts



Candidates without MSP experience will not be considered.



To apply, please include:

1. A short paragraph explaining your MSP experience.

2. A description of how you would troubleshoot a Microsoft 365 login issue affecting one user.

3. Your current internet speed (upload/download).

4. Your computer specifications.

5. Confirmation that you can work Hawaii business hours.

title: Project Manager (SEO & E-commerce)
description:
(SERBIA)

Job Title: Project Manager (SEO & E-commerce)

Employment Type: Full-time (40 hours/week)



About the company



LEADSPRING is a results-driven affiliate SEO agency built on quality, communication, and teamwork. The fast-growing company seeks a Project Manager to deliver excellence across SEO and e-commerce projects.



About the Role

As Project Manager at Leadspring, oversee SEO campaigns, manage cross-functional teams, and ensure deliverables meet high standards. Focus on SEO/project management for Shopify and e-commerce sites while coordinating with the paid ads team for channel alignment. Thrive in a fast-paced environment valuing detail-orientation, proactivity, growth, and accountability.



Qualifications & Competencies

 ‚Ä¢ Driven, motivated, and detail-oriented

 ‚Ä¢ Advanced-level SEO experience with proven results in Shopify and e-commerce SEO

 ‚Ä¢ Basic to intermediate understanding of paid advertising (Google Ads, Meta Ads, etc.)

 ‚Ä¢ Comfortable managing multiple tasks simultaneously

 ‚Ä¢ Able to thrive under pressure and adapt quickly to changing priorities

title: Medical Virtual Assistant | Women‚Äôs Health & Thyroid Clinic
description:
Medical Virtual Assistant

Remote | Philippines-Based | Clinical Practice Support

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented Medical Virtual Assistant to support the clinical operations of a busy women‚Äôs health and thyroid-focused naturopathic medical practice based in Ontario, Canada.

This practice specializes in hormone health, thyroid conditions, and root-cause care for women. 

You will work directly with Dr. Robin to ensure patient charts, lab results, billing, and prescriptions are handled accurately and efficiently.

This is a medical support role requiring comfort with lab data, structured documentation, financial accuracy, and strong attention to detail. Strict confidentiality and professionalism are required when handling sensitive patient information.

You will be joining a small, established team with clear systems in place. Another experienced Virtual Assistant supports
 and administrative workflows, and you will collaborate via Slack during morning Eastern Time hours. Structured SOPs and training are provided to support your success.

This position is available immediately, with a target start date in March 2026. Candidates must be ready to begin onboarding within 2 weeks.

This is a part-time role of approximately 20 to 30 hours per month. Work is completed during morning Eastern Time hours, with flexibility as long as communication windows are maintained.

________________________________________

Core Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Upload and organize lab results in Jane (EMR system)

‚Ä¢ Retrieve and download lab results from external laboratory portals as required

‚Ä¢ Extract lab values and enter them accurately into patient charts according to established SOPs

‚Ä¢ Prepare charts prior to appointments by carrying forward relevant Objective and Assessment sections from previous visits

‚Ä¢ Create lab requisitions based on instructions from Dr. Robin

‚Ä¢ Send lab requisitions to patients with templated instructions following appointments

‚Ä¢ Process appointment billing independently and ensure all lab fees are added accurately before charging patient cards

‚Ä¢ Double-check invoices carefully for completeness and pricing accuracy prior to payment processing

‚Ä¢ Maintain precise and organized billing records

‚Ä¢ Send lab results, handouts, and Care Plans to patients using approved template messages

‚Ä¢ Fax prescriptions and confirm successful transmission

‚Ä¢ Maintain prescription tracking documentation

‚Ä¢ Prepare Care Plan templates by inserting current ND and MD lab results and organizing data for physician review

‚Ä¢ Track time accurately and submit detailed invoices

________________________________________

Requirements

‚Ä¢ Minimum 1 year experience as a Virtual Assistant

‚Ä¢ Medical or clinical VA experience strongly preferred

‚Ä¢ Experience working inside an EMR system preferred

‚Ä¢ Comfortable working with lab panels and medical terminology

‚Ä¢ Excellent written English and strong comprehension of spoken English for training videos

‚Ä¢ Exceptional attention to detail. Billing accuracy is critical, as invoices are processed without secondary review

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to work independently with high accountability

‚Ä¢ Strong internal quality control habits, including double checking work before submission

‚Ä¢ Reliable computer and stable high speed internet

‚Ä¢ Available Monday to Friday during Canadian Eastern Time mornings

‚Ä¢ Responsive during morning ET hours for communication and coordination via Slack

‚Ä¢ Comfortable using Slack, Google Drive, and AI tools with structured prompts

‚Ä¢ Commitment to confidentiality. All patient information must remain secure

________________________________________

Work Hours & Availability

‚Ä¢ Approximately 20 to 30 hours per month to start, with opportunity to grow

‚Ä¢ This role is well suited to a Virtual Assistant managing multiple clients, provided responsiveness and accuracy are maintained.

‚Ä¢ Must be available Monday to Friday during Eastern Time mornings for Slack communication and task coordination

‚Ä¢ On Tuesdays and Wednesdays Eastern Time (ET), you must be available during morning ET hours to send patients their lab results prior to their scheduled appointments

‚Ä¢ All other tasks may be completed on a flexible schedule, provided they are completed before midnight Canadian time

________________________________________

Compensation

‚Ä¢ Paid via Wise

‚Ä¢ Biweekly or monthly payment

‚Ä¢ Please include your expected hourly rate in your application materials.

‚Ä¢ This is a long-term hourly position. Compensation is based on experience.

________________________________________

Ideal Candidate

You are:

‚Ä¢ Organized and structured

‚Ä¢ Highly detail-oriented and naturally double-check your work

‚Ä¢ Comfortable working with numbers and lab data

‚Ä¢ Able to follow detailed SOPs precisely and ask questions when unsure

‚Ä¢ Professional, proactive, and reliable

‚Ä¢ Seeking a stable, long-term position, not short-term project work

________________________________________



Perks

‚Ä¢ Stable, long-term role within an organized clinical practice

‚Ä¢ Clear systems, structured SOPs, and consistent workflows

‚Ä¢ Flexible hours outside required morning ET availability

‚Ä¢ Direct communication and a respectful, professional working environment

‚Ä¢ Opportunity for increased hours and responsibility over time





________________________________________

How to Apply

Please apply through OnlineJobs.ph and include:

1. A short introduction

2. Your experience with medical or clinical VA tasks

3. Your availability for morning communication during Canadian Eastern Time, including your typical ET hours

4. Your expected hourly rate

5. In the FIRST line of your cover letter, write exactly:

Medical Virtual Assistant Application ‚Äì Thyroid Care

Applications that do not include all 5 items will not be reviewed

title: Customer Service Representative/Sales Coordinator
description:
I‚Äôm looking for a detail-oriented customer service/sales assistant to take ownership of our entire lead-to-job workflow cycle. Most of our clients reach out by phone, so clear, proficient, confident and friendly English on both inbound and outbound sales calls is essential. 



You will handle every touchpoint after the first ring: noting enquiries that come in by phone, SMS, web form or
, qualifying each lead, locking in an inspection time with our senior technician, following up on sent quotes, nudging clients about unpaid invoices, and‚Äîonce the work is complete‚Äîpolitely requesting a google review for the business. 



Calls and sms are managed through a platform called LeadConnector and I track everything in Trello boards. If you have a smarter way to keep the pipeline visible, I‚Äôm open, but you must at least be comfortable living inside Trello from day one.



Where I need the heaviest lift is answering and returning calls and SMS and booking inspections as well as contacting customers post quote acceptance and managing the job schedule. Speed matters here, so you‚Äôll need to find mutually convenient slots with the client, confirm details, and drop the appointment straight onto my calendar without back-and-forth.



This will ideally turn into a long-term, full-time position. If you‚Äôre organised, confident on the phone especially with warm outbound Sales, and eager to run the show from first enquiry to glowing review, let‚Äôs talk.



Must be available to answer all incoming calls and SMS between 9am-5pm Sydney Australia time (average calls per day can range from 1-10 incoming calls/sms) however all other admin tasks and outbound calls can be more flexible and made at later hours. 

   

We offer a base hourly rate plus a commission structure to be discussed during interview process.

title: Social Media Manager & Content Creator
description:
Build a Media Brand That Takes Over an Industry



About Us

Our company is a fast-scaling, multi-vertical property tech company redefining how people buy, sell, rent, and manage property, without agents. Our flagship platform is the first agentless real estate ecosystem, powered by automation, legal compliance, and smart systems. We have been dubbed the Uber of Real Estate

We‚Äôre currently in stealth mode, preparing for a national public launch. This is a rare opportunity to join at the ground level of a disruptive brand backed by years of planning, serious tech, and major ambitions.



Role Overview

We‚Äôre looking for a high-performing, senior Social Media Manager & Content Creator to own and execute our social content strategy across Instagram, TikTok,
, LinkedIn, Threads, and more.

You‚Äôll work closely with our founder to drive brand awareness, build a cult-like following, launch viral campaigns, attract early sellers and buyers, and create content that makes agents nervous and audiences obsessed.



Key Responsibilities

Plan, create, and post daily content across IG, TikTok, FB, LinkedIn & more

Create and manage monthly content calendars across multiple verticals 

Write engaging, on-brand captions with sharp hooks, clear CTAs, and platform-specific tones

Edit reels and short-form videos (raw footage provided or repurposed from internal content)

Manage comment replies, DMs, shares, and cross-platform engagement

Identify and leverage trending audio, 
s, formats, and hashtags

Produce professional visual assets

Build hype for competitions & campaigns

Track metrics, growth, engagement, and make data-backed content decisions

Expectations

Be proactive: Suggest and execute new ideas weekly, fortnightly & monthly, not just follow orders.

Stay up to date: Monitor trends, 
s, algorithm changes, competitor activity & report back.

Protect the brand: Proofread everything, escalate risks, and never post off-brand content.

Be responsive: Quick to answer, quick to adapt. Social is 24/7.

Move fast

Measure & iterate: Regularly A/B test content, double down on what works.

Collaborate: Work closely with our founder & their EA

Document: Maintain a living content calendar, asset library, and reporting sheet.

This is not a ‚Äúsocial media job‚Äù. We‚Äôre building a media machine to support one of the most ambitious property technology launches. Our goal isn‚Äôt to ‚Äúgrow an Instagram page‚Äù. Our goal is to dominate attention, shape the conversation, and make our brand unavoidable.



We want our social channels to feel like a media company, fast, opinionated, disciplined, creative, relentless



If your idea of social media is posting a few graphics each week and waiting for likes, this role is not for you. If you love building 
ntum, spotting angles, cutting sharp videos, reacting fast, and watching content explode, keep reading.



Our platform has been dubbed the Uber of Real Estate. We‚Äôre launching aggressively and we expect attention, criticism & scale, and we‚Äôre building a serious media operation to match that ambition.



What you‚Äôll actually be doing day to day



You will run our social presence, and that means:

‚Ä¢ planning content

‚Ä¢ creating content

‚Ä¢ editing content

‚Ä¢ posting content

‚Ä¢ reacting to what happens because of the content

‚Ä¢ and doing it again, faster, smarter, better



Platforms Managed

‚Ä¢ Instagram (posts, reels, stories)

‚Ä¢
 (page, groups)

‚Ä¢ TikTok (videos, trends, skits)

‚Ä¢ YouTube (shorts, testimonials, explainer videos)

‚Ä¢ LinkedIn (company, founder profile)

‚Ä¢ Threads

‚Ä¢
/X (brand, PR, viral threads)

‚Ä¢ Google Business Profile (for reviews and posts)



Some days you‚Äôll be editing planned content, other days you‚Äôll be cutting a clip or post within hours because something unexpected blew up. 



This role rewards people who think like editors and producers, not just schedulers.



Some content is planned a month ahead, some content is created because something just happened. You need to be good at both.



What we‚Äôre looking for:



We‚Äôre looking for someone who already knows what they‚Äôre doing.

You should have 5+ years of experience managing brand social media, not personal pages and not hobby accounts.



You should:



‚Ä¢ personally edit short-form video (this is non-negotiable)

‚Ä¢ understand hooks, pacing, subtitles, and retention

‚Ä¢ have taste and restraint, not just trend addiction

‚Ä¢ be comfortable producing 15‚Äì20 pieces of content per week

‚Ä¢ stay calm when comments turn negative or heated

‚Ä¢ enjoy fast-moving environments



This is not a role where someone tells you exactly what to post every day. You‚Äôre expected to have initiative & think.



What success looks like



After a few months, our accounts should feel like: ‚ÄúThese guys are everywhere.‚Äù

Content should:

‚Ä¢ spark discussion

‚Ä¢ trigger reactions

‚Ä¢ get shared into group chats

‚Ä¢ be stitched, duetted, screenshotted

‚Ä¢ shape how people talk about the industry



If something hits, you know how to milk it.

Why this role is exciting

title: Logistics / Supply Chain Analyst
description:
Location: Remote ‚Äì Philippines

Type: Full-Time



About the Role



We are looking for a highly analytical Logistics / Supply Chain Analyst to support end-to-end supply chain planning, logistics performance tracking, and data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate has senior-level Excel skills, strong analytical capabilities, and experience working with operations, procurement, inventory, or 3PL teams.



This role requires someone who can turn raw operational data into actionable insights, optimize workflows, and support strategic planning across the supply chain.



Key Responsibilities



Supply Chain & Logistics Analysis

Analyze inventory levels, replenishment needs, order flows, and lead times to ensure product availability.

Monitor logistics KPIs including OTIF, order accuracy, freight costs, and warehouse performance.

Track inbound/outbound shipments and identify bottlenecks affecting delivery timelines.

Support demand planning by analyzing sales, forecast accuracy, and SKU performance.



Reporting & Dashboarding

Build, maintain, and automate complex Excel models for forecasting, inventory planning, and cost analysis.

Develop dashboards and weekly/monthly reporting packs for operations leaders.

Consolidate data across multiple sources (ERP, WMS, 3PL dashboards, spreadsheets) for executive-level reporting.



Operational Optimization

Identify inefficiencies in logistics processes and recommend data-driven improvements.

Analyze vendor and freight performance, comparing SLA adherence and cost-effectiveness.

Support procurement and replenishment decisions with robust data models and simulations.

Partner with warehouses, suppliers, and internal teams to resolve discrepancies or supply interruptions.



Cross-Functional Collaboration

Work closely with operations, finance, merchandising, and logistics partners.

Prepare and present insights, trends, and recommendations to management.

Assist in SOP development and operational workflow improvements.



Qualifications

Required

3‚Äì5+ years of experience in logistics, supply chain analysis, operations analysis, or related roles.

Senior-level Excel expertise, including:

Advanced formulas (INDEX/MATCH, XLOOKUP, SUMIFS, ARRAY formulas)

Pivot tables and Power Query

Scenario modeling and complex multi-sheet workbooks

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret large datasets and identify actionable insights.

Experience working with supply chain tools (ERP, WMS, OMS, 3PL portals).

Excellent communication skills‚Äîable to explain complex findings in a clear, structured manner.

Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and problem-solving skills.



Preferred

Experience in eCommerce, retail, CPG, or multi-channel supply chain environments.

Familiarity with SQL, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar analytics tools.

Experience with demand planning or inventory forecasting models.



Who You Are

Highly analytical and detail-oriented

Comfortable managing and interpreting large datasets

Proactive in identifying problems and proposing solutions

Organized, dependable, and able to work independently

Strong communicator and collaborator



Please send a link to your resume to apply.

This is NOT a customer service or marketing role.

This is an operations control position.



Daily Responsibilities



Log into Shopify and filter UNFULFILLED orders.



Filter orders by yesterday‚Äôs date (orders ship the following business day).



Batch same-SKU orders together for efficient warehouse processing.



Input correct shipping details according to our SOP:



Weight



Box size



Shipping service type



Generate shipping labels.



Extract and batch Order IDs after label creation.



Upload structured order data into our master Google Sheet:



Order ID



SKU type



Quantity



Misc cost



Prep type (box or envelope)



Upload and organize daily shipping labels into structured folders by:



Client



Date



SKU batch



Labels must be uploaded and organized EVERY day.



Daily Reporting Requirement



Before logging off each day, you must submit a structured fulfillment report including:



Total unfulfilled orders at start of day



Total orders processed



Total labels generated



SKU breakdown



Confirmation spreadsheet was updated



Any discrepancies or issues



Time log (start/end time)



This is mandatory.



Requirements



Strong Shopify experience (REQUIRED)



Experience batching orders by SKU



Extremely detail-oriented



Comfortable working with shipping data



Google Sheets proficiency



Ability to follow structured SOP exactly



Available during U.S. CST business hours



Stable internet connection



To Apply



Send a short Loom video (2‚Äì3 minutes) explaining:



Your Shopify experience



How you would batch orders by SKU efficiently



Your experience handling shipping labels



Applications without a Loom video will not be reviewed.

title: Cinematic Travel Series Producer (Hospitality & Lifestyle)
description:
Do You Feel Your Video Editing & Long-Form Storytelling Skills Are Cinematic?



Can you take beautifully shot travel footage and shape it into something emotionally compelling?



Can you create hospitality storytelling that feels refined, immersive, and intentional ‚Äî not loud or influencer-driven?



If you understand pacing, presence, and emotional resonance in editing‚Ä¶ keep reading.



Cinematic Travel Series Editor



Go Travel Community | Hospitality-Driven Travel Brand



About Go Travel Community



Go Travel Community is not a booking site.

We are not a traditional travel agency.



We are building a belief-led hospitality ecosystem rooted in:



‚Ä¢ Intentional travel

‚Ä¢ Meaningful community

‚Ä¢ Elevated experiences

‚Ä¢ Human connection

‚Ä¢ Impact-driven exploration



Our brand exists at the intersection of hospitality, storytelling, and emotional resonance.



We are launching a Virgin Voyages travel content series and are seeking a skilled Video Editor to transform captured footage into a cohesive, emotionally intelligent long-form episode and supporting social content.



This is not influencer-style ‚Äúlook at me‚Äù content.

This is not loud luxury.



This is refined, emotionally grounded hospitality storytelling.



Our tone:

80% emotion

20% intellect

Calm confidence

Elevated but inclusive

Story-driven, never salesy



The content should make viewers feel:

Present

Inspired

Expanded

Curious

Part of something bigger



Role Overview



This is a post-production focused role.



All footage will be professionally captured and provided.

You will collaborate closely with a founder-led brand to shape narrative, pacing, tone, and emotional arc.



We are looking for someone who understands cinematic storytelling ‚Äî not just technical cutting.



This is a flexible, project-based opportunity with potential for ongoing collaboration as the series expands.



Key Responsibilities



‚Ä¢ Edit one long-form episode (approximately 30‚Äì45 minutes)

‚Ä¢ Shape strong emotional and narrative structure from provided footage

‚Ä¢ Create multiple vertical short-form edits (Reels, TikTok, Shorts)

‚Ä¢ Apply intentional pacing and music selection

‚Ä¢ Perform clean, polished color grading

‚Ä¢ Integrate immersive but subtle sound design

‚Ä¢ Collaborate creatively while remaining efficient and organized

‚Ä¢ Deliver structured final files and project assets



Required Skills & Experience



‚Ä¢ Strong cinematic storytelling sensibility

‚Ä¢ Advanced proficiency in professional editing software

‚Ä¢ Experience editing long-form content (30+ minutes)

‚Ä¢ Ability to balance luxury aesthetics with authenticity

‚Ä¢ Understanding of hospitality, lifestyle, or travel branding

‚Ä¢ Strong communication and collaboration skills

‚Ä¢ Ability to work within defined scope and timelines



Preferred Experience



‚Ä¢ Travel or hospitality editing experience

‚Ä¢ Documentary-style pacing

‚Ä¢ Experience creating both long-form and short-form content from the same footage

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with YouTube storytelling structure

‚Ä¢ Understanding of emotionally intelligent brand positioning



Deliverables Expectations (Per Episode)



‚Ä¢ One long-form episode (30‚Äì45 minutes)

‚Ä¢ 3‚Äì6 vertical short-form cuts

‚Ä¢ Clean audio balance and music integration

‚Ä¢ Light color correction and polish

‚Ä¢ Organized project file delivery



Final scope and number of short-form edits will be aligned prior to project start to ensure clarity and creative focus.



Tone & Creative Alignment



Your editing should prioritize:



‚Ä¢ Presence over hype

‚Ä¢ Atmosphere over spectacle

‚Ä¢ Emotion over ego

‚Ä¢ Story over sales



We are not documenting luxury for display.

We are capturing hospitality as a lived, shared experience.



What Success Looks Like



‚Ä¢ Viewers feel transported, not marketed to

‚Ä¢ The brand feels cohesive and elevated

‚Ä¢ The storytelling feels intentional and emotionally resonant

‚Ä¢ The founder feels creatively supported

‚Ä¢ The audience feels like they belong



Compensation



$12 ‚Äì $15 per hour

(approximately ?670 ‚Äì ?850 per hour, depending on exchange rate)



Estimated per episode range: $500 ‚Äì $700 USD



Compensation is based on experience, efficiency, and portfolio strength.



Opportunity for ongoing collaboration as we continue building our long-form travel series.



If your editing style is thoughtful, refined, and emotionally aware ‚Äî we would love to see your work.



Please apply with:



‚Ä¢ Portfolio or reel

‚Ä¢ One example of long-form storytelling

‚Ä¢ Examples of short-form edits

‚Ä¢ A brief note describing your approach to hospitality or travel storytelling



Thank You!

title: Guest Support for Short Term Rental Company

- The assessment you‚Äôre about to take is designed to understand how you think ‚Äî how you prioritize, communicate, and make judgment calls when there isn‚Äôt one obvious right answer.

- If you enjoy solving realistic scenarios, thinking critically, and taking ownership, you will likely enjoy both this assessment and the job itself. If you are looking for a simple, scripted support role, this probably won‚Äôt be the right fit ‚Äî and that‚Äôs okay.

The Standard: Do Not Apply Unless You Are Incredible

We are not looking for "help." We are looking for a miracle worker. We are a premier marketing agency serving the U.S. Collision Repair (Body Shop) industry. We help shop owners tough, busy entrepreneurs, get more crashed cars into their shops.



Our owner, Shah, is the only salesperson. We have a high-tech system in place where leads from various avenues are automatically prompted to schedule an appointment. Your job is the human safety net. If a lead does not book, if they cancel, or if they "think about it," you are the one who hunts them down. You will follow up until they sign, they tell you to stop, or they are dead.

The Brutal Truth (Read This Carefully)

This is a high-pressure, high-volume role.



The English Requirement: You must speak English with zero accent. Your cadence, slang, and tone must be indistinguishable from a native North American speaker. You will be calling blue-collar business owners in the U.S.; you must sound friendly, professional, and natural. If you have a "call center" accent, do not apply.



The Intensity: You will be on the phone and in GoHighLevel all day.



The Responsibility: You are the gatekeeper of Shah‚Äôs calendar. If his calendar has a gap, you are losing the company money.



Your 5 Orders of Priority

The Calendar Guardian: You call and confirm every single lead on Shah‚Äôs schedule for today, tomorrow, and the day after. If they don't confirm by phone, they don't get the meeting.



The Gap Filler (The Hunter): If a lead is booked for next Tuesday, but Shah has a gap today at 2:00 PM, you call that lead and convince them to move their appointment up to today.



The Resurrector: You track every "No-Show." You call them within 5 minutes of their missed meeting to get them back on the books.



The Persistence Specialist: You follow up with every lead that "slipped through the cracks." If the automation didn't get them to book, you do it manually. You manage the "Long-Game" leads who saw a demo but haven't signed yet.



The Newsletter Architect: You will draft weekly persuasive newsletters using our "Proof of Success" (e.g., how we generated $45k in revenue for a shop in 3 months) to nurture our database into booking calls.



Technical Requirements

GoHighLevel (GHL) Mastery: You must be proficient in GHL pipelines and CRM management.



System Builder: You must be able to create your own SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) so that your follow-up process is repeatable and flawless.



The "Safety Net" Mindset: You take it personally when a lead is "lost."



THE GAUNTLET: How To Apply

Failure to follow these instructions exactly results in an immediate "Deleted" status.



Step 1: Your Subject Line Must read: "I am the Lead Superhero Shah is looking for - [Your Full Name]"



Step 2: Tell me what my name



Step 3: Written Questions (Answer in your application)



Describe a time you built a manual follow-up system that increased conversion.



What is your philosophy on "Lead Leakage"?



If you were an animal, what would you be and why? (Be creative).



Briefly explain how a DRP (Direct Repair Program) works in a U.S. Body Shop.



What is a "supplement" in collision repair and why does it matter to a shop owner?



Step 4: THE VIDEO (Mandatory Final Filter) Provide a link to a Loom or direct video (5 minutes maximum). IF YOU DO NOT DO THIS YOUR APPLICATION WILL IMMEDIATELY BW REJECTED.



Section A (Intro): Introduce yourself and describe your experience with cars or the automotive industry.



Section B (The Quiz): Answer these on camera without reading a script:



What is the difference between a fender and a bumper?



How do insurance deductibles work?



What does it mean for a customer to "pay out of pocket" vs. "go through insurance"?



Section C (The Roleplay): Shah has an open slot at 2:00 PM today. A lead named "John" is scheduled for next Friday. Call John and use your natural, friendly, persuasive English to move him to the 2:00 PM slot today. We are judging your accent, your confidence, and your "vibe."

title: Property Management Support

mbers.

Other Responsibilities

About You

title: Video Editor for History YouTube Channel ‚Äì Motion Graphics & Maps Required
description:
We run a history YouTube channel and are looking for an editor for our video focused on the Mongol Empire ‚Äì covering everything from steppe politics and tribal warfare to the absolutely mental characters and events that shaped the largest contiguous empire in history. We lean into the absurdity of it all because, frankly, history was wild.



What We're Looking For:



A skilled video editor who can bring historical content to life through dynamic editing, motion graphics, and custom map visuals.



The Work Includes:



Editing long-form documentary-style videos (typically 15-40 minutes)

Creating animated maps showing troop movements, territorial changes, and the shifting political landscape of medieval Asia

Designing motion graphics for: family trees/genealogies, timelines, key events, and name/title cards

Syncing visuals to narration with appropriate pacing

Adding dramatic music and sound design

Sourcing and integrating historical imagery, paintings, and manuscripts



Required Skills:



Proficiency in Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut

Strong motion graphics skills (After Effects preferred)

Experience creating animated maps or willingness to develop this

Ability to work with complex historical content and keep it visually engaging

Reliable communication and ability to meet deadlines



Bonus Points If You:



Have experience editing longform history/documentary content

Can create custom illustrations or have access to stock resources



This is the first episode in a series, so if we like your work there are more episodes to come.



Please include your portfolio/showreel (especially any map animations or history-related work), your typical turnaround time, and your rate per video or per hour.

title: Marketing & Short Form Video Editor
description:
About the Client



You‚Äôll be supporting an Australian creator-led business in the dance/education space with a large back-catalogue of video content and an active audience across YouTube and
. The work is practical, fast-moving, and focused on getting consistent content out the door‚Äîwithout overcomplicating things.



Your Impact



Within 90 days, you‚Äôll help the creator publish short-form content consistently, reduce the weekly ‚Äúcontent bottleneck‚Äù, and build a simple, repeatable workflow that keeps 
ntum. This isn‚Äôt about perfection‚Äîit‚Äôs about reliable output, clean execution, and steady improvement.



Key Responsibilities



Repurpose existing long-form videos into YouTube Shorts using an efficient workflow (AI clip generation + selection + light editing).

Create batches of draft shorts, flag the strongest clips, and refine them so they‚Äôre clear, watchable, and on-brand.

Apply a consistent style using existing templates (captions/look & feel), with small improvements over time.

Export, upload, and schedule Shorts to the YouTube channel (titles, basic metadata, consistency).

Create/update thumbnails in Canva using provided templates (no need to design from scratch).

Track performance basics (views, retention, simple trends) and share a weekly snapshot to guide what to double down on.

Communicate daily: end-of-day update covering what you did / what didn‚Äôt work / what‚Äôs next / blockers.

As capacity allows (later stage): cross-post selected Shorts to
/Instagram and assist with simple marketing admin (e.g., basic newsletter or opt-in support using existing tools/templates).

Must-Have Qualifications (Self-Check)



2+ years editing short-form content (Shorts/Reels/TikTok) with a focus on speed + clarity

Comfortable working with Filmora (Wondershare) or willing to learn it quickly (and/or propose a faster tool that achieves the same outcome)

Confident uploading and scheduling content on YouTube

Canva skills (template-based thumbnails and simple visual assets)

Strong English comprehension (you can judge whether a clip ‚Äúmakes sense‚Äù and catch awkward cut points)

Proactive communicator: You raise blockers early and don‚Äôt disappear

Can work within AEST overlap and provide daily EOD updates

Reliable home setup: stable internet, headset, and a distraction-managed workspace

Nice-to-Have Skills



Experience using YouTube optimisation tools (e.g., vidIQ/keyword tools) for titles and basic SEO

Experience 
 content across
/Instagram (platform-specific formatting awareness)

Familiarity with newsletter/email platforms (Kajabi/Mailchimp/Beehiiv or similar)

A strong creative eye: you can suggest small tweaks that lift quality without adding hours

Success Outcomes (30/60/90 Days)



30 Days: You can run the full Shorts workflow end-to-end with minimal supervision; publish consistently (target range: 8‚Äì15 Shorts/week, depending on complexity), with clean captions and sensible clip selection.

60 Days: You help lock in a repeatable ‚Äúhouse style‚Äù (templates + do/don‚Äôt examples), reduce rework, and improve titles/thumbnails consistency.

90 Days: Publishing is steady and predictable; weekly reporting is clear; turnaround time improves; the creator feels confident the content machine runs without chasing.



Job Type: Part-time

title: CPA Accountant/Manager

Looking for an employee who wants high pay and high responsibility. We are looking for an experienced CPA accountant with Quickbooks online experience to help clean our books as we grow and scale into a bigger business with more complex needs. You will start at $5/hour base for the first month and increase exponentially by helping me train and manage additional employees. I am an e-commerce business owner who is in rapid expansion mode with livestreams. Every employee we can hire and train can increase my business exponentially with unlimited cap. However, there is a limit to what I can manage because I am also growing a sales team in America for the livestreams and need help with bookkeeping and moderating the livestreams. 



You will receive an additional $1/hour bump with each new remote employee you help me train and manage on top of your $5/ hour base. 



I am looking for employees who will not work another job, who will not be late and who won't waste working hours not performing at 110%. You will be tracked based on mouse movements and also Zoom video is required to be left on and we will check at random. There are high expectations for this job since it is highly compensated with base and growth of management. Please do not apply if you will not commit to longterm growth with me and aren't aggressive in wanting to make a lot of money and take on more and more responsibility managing people under you. Please be aware that you will be tracked closely, showing up to your shift even by 1 minute late will result in your choice of automatic firing or pay deduction for 1 week, idle time shown on mouse and keyboard tracking will result in your choice of automatic firing or pay deduction. Your online 
 profile will be monitored and any other job applications after being hired will result in automatic firing. 



I am looking looking for someone who is motivated to grow with me longterm and will not waste my time, I have had previous poor experiences of employees who were working multiple jobs and making mistakes or not showing up on time, and it disrupts my business because an e-commerce livestream business with many moving parts is demanding. Please only apply if you are ready to make a lot of money but also have a lot of responsibility. I grew up poor living 3 families to 1 apartment and now grew my business  to over $2 million revenue due to hard work, I only want employees who have the same hustle hard work mindset that I have and will compensate very well for that fire and hunger to a better life.



To make sure you are attention detailed, please write as the first sentence what your favorite food is. If the first sentence does not contain your favorite food, your lack of reading comprehension and ability to focus on details will not be a good fit in this demanding company of mine that requires dedication. Please be aware that all applicants must have a minimum of 80 for ID proof score. Full time only, no part time not committed to high growth people.

title: School Outreach Caller (UK Primary Schools)
description:
About Us



Kings & Queens Chess is a UK-based education company that runs after-school chess clubs in primary schools. We work closely with schools to deliver engaging, structured, and enjoyable chess sessions for children.



The Role



We‚Äôre looking for a confident, friendly, English-speaking caller to contact UK primary schools and introduce our after-school chess clubs. Your role is to speak with school offices, identify the correct contact person, share basic information, and pass interested schools to our management team for follow-up.



This is not a hard sales role ‚Äî the focus is polite outreach, relationship-building, and lead generation.



Key Responsibilities



- Call UK primary schools during UK school hours (09:00 to 15:00 GMT)

- Speak politely and professionally with school office staff

- Introduce Kings & Queens Chess and our chess clubs (script will be provided)

- Share headline information (session format, general pricing, flexibility)

- Log call outcomes accurately in a spreadsheet or CRM

- Escalate interested schools to management for follow-up



What We‚Äôre Looking For



- Excellent spoken and written English

- A calm, friendly, and professional phone manner

- Previous calling, virtual assistant, or admin experience preferred

- Comfortable speaking with schools and education professionals

- Reliable, organised, and detail-oriented

- Able to follow scripts and guidelines closely



Hours & Pay



- Hours aligned with UK school hours

- Starting at ?220 per hour, depending on experience

- Opportunity for additional bonuses based on performance



How to Apply



Please include:



- A short introduction about yourself

- Any previous calling or outreach experience

- A brief example of how you would introduce our service to a UK primary school.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Skills play a vital role in a workforce but We believe that hiring character over skill is the basic foundation for building a smart, efficient, passionate, driven, and impactful workforce.



AT MERIDIAN, WE FOCUS ON PEOPLE OVER PROFITS



Overview



Role Summary:



The Executive Assistant provides high-reliability administrative and operational support to the CEO and CCO. This role is responsible for managing calendars, communications, logistics, and follow-through to ensure executive time and priorities are protected and executed effectively.



Key Responsibilities



Daily Responsibilities

Calendar Management & Meeting Coordination

- Schedule, update, and coordinate meetings, appointments, and events

- Manage scheduling conflicts and ensure calendars are accurate and up to date



Inbox Triage & Communication Support



- Monitor, organize, and prioritize executive inboxes

- Draft responses or prepare summaries as requested



Document Preparation & Writing



- Draft and edit
s, memos, presentations, and decks

Travel Arrangements

- Aggregate call notes and ensure timely, organized entry into HubSpot

s after sales calls, including links, proposals, or terms docs as needed

Ad Hoc Research



- Conduct quick-turnaround research on vendors, tools, or topics

Monthly / Ongoing Responsibilities



Follow-Ups & Action Item Tracking



- Track outstanding tasks and commitments

- Follow up with relevant parties to ensure timely completion



Vendor & Partner Coordination



- Manage routine communications with vendors and external partners

- Support basic coordination as requested by executives



Conference and Field Support



- Coordinate conference logistics (registration, travel, hotel, booth setup, collateral)

- Track speaking engagements, key meetings, and networking events

- Assist with post-event follow-up workflows



Required Skills



- Fluent written and spoken English

- Previous experience as an Executive Assistant or similar administrative role

- Strong proficiency with Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Sheets, Slides, Forms)

- Strong proficiency with Slack

- Strong proficiency with PDF editing

- Excellent organizational and time-management skills

- High attention to detail and follow-through

- Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities

- Comfortable supporting senior executives and familiarity with handling confidential information



Nice-to-Have Skills



- Previous EA experience supporting a technology or software-focused organization

- Familiarity with best practices for remote, distributed teams

- Conversational to fluent Spanish ( NOTED REQUIRED BUT HAS A GREATER CHANCE OF BEING HIRED )

- Any familiarity with Hubspot, Linear and Zendesk

????? KLAYVIO

 campaigns



SHOPIFY & ETSY LISTINGS

? What This Role Is NOT

We evaluate: responsiveness, check-ins, accuracy, follow-through, proactivity, and reduction of mental load.

title: Contract Admin
description:
The Role

You will be responsible for the end-to-end administration of contracts, ensuring financial accuracy through variation management and progress claims, and providing critical support to our Project Managers and Estimators.



Key Responsibilities

Why Join Us?

**This is a dynamic and varied role, so you won‚Äôt ever be bored. Every day will bring new challenges and opportunities to learn.

**This is a great opportunity for someone seeking a challenging yet rewarding position with a growing company.

title: Automation & Data Pipeline Engineer
description:
Core Platform Experience

- n8n (strong hands-on experience)

- Zapier / Make.com (nice to have)

- Workflow debugging in node-based automation tools

- Handling binary data inside automation environments

- Managing large batch executions (hundreds/thousands of items)



HTTP & Networking

- Deep understanding of HTTP methods (GET, POST)

- Response types: text, JSON, file/binary

- Headers and content negotiation

- Accept-Encoding / gzip handling

- Handling long-running or large HTTP responses

- API pagination and rate limiting

- Error handling and retry logic



Data Formats

- XML (strong experience)

- XML namespaces and sitemap schema structure

- JSON transformation

- CSV transformation (nice to have)

- Understanding of structured vs semi-structured data



Compression & File Handling

- Gzip (.gz) handling

- Binary file streams

- Base64 encoding/decoding

- MIME types and content types

- Understanding of how automation platforms store binary fields

- Decompression workflows in low-code environments



JavaScript / Scripting

- Strong JavaScript (Node.js context)

- Working within restricted runtime environments

- Buffer handling

- Debugging execution environments

- Familiarity with zlib and compression concepts (even if not directly usable)



Cloud & Serverless (Strongly Preferred)

- Cloudflare Workers

- AWS Lambda

- Lightweight proxy endpoints

- Writing minimal HTTP transformation services

- Deploying serverless scripts for file transformation

- Handling streaming responses



Data Processing & Pipelines

- Batch processing patterns

- Split-in-batches logic

- Memory-safe processing

- Idempotent job design

- Handling large sitemap trees

- Designing resilient ingestion pipelines



Debugging & Diagnostics

- Reading raw HTTP responses

- Debugging binary vs JSON mismatches

- Understanding how low-code tools represent internal data

- Inspecting request/response metadata

- Logging and tracing failures in automation platforms



Architecture Thinking

- When to process inside automation tool vs offload to serverless

- Trade-offs between low-code and custom code

- Designing reliable data ingestion systems

- Handling large structured public data sources (e.g., sitemaps)



Nice to Have

- Python (requests, gzip, lxml, BeautifulSoup)

- Experience scraping structured public datasets

- Experience with search engine sitemaps at scale

- Experience handling multi-level sitemap hierarchies

title: Full Stack Developer - Laravel, Intertia, React, PHP
description:
Full Stack Developer (Laravel + React + Inertia)

The Opportunity



We are looking for a Product-Minded Full Stack Developer to join our team. You will be building a modern, monolithic application using the LILT stack (Laravel, Inertia, React, Tailwind).



We value developer velocity and type safety. We don‚Äôt use a separate API unless necessary; instead, we leverage Inertia.js to build a seamless Single Page Application (SPA) feel with the routing and productivity of a classic Laravel backend.



Our Tech Stack



- Core: Laravel 11, PHP 8.x



- Frontend: React (Hooks, Context), Inertia.js



- Language: TypeScript (Strict typing across the full stack)



- Styling: Tailwind CSS



- Infrastructure & Reliability: Redis, Laravel Horizon, Sentry



What You‚Äôll Do



- Build End-to-End Features: Architect and implement features from the database migration to the React component, ensuring a snappy, reactive user experience.



- Manage Asynchronous Workflows: You won't just run everything in the request cycle. You will utilize Laravel Jobs and Redis to handle triggers, notifications, and complex data processing in the background.



- Ensure System Reliability: Monitor and optimize application health using Laravel Horizon for queue management and Sentry for error tracking. You‚Äôll be responsible for debugging failed jobs and maintaining a clean error log.



- Maintain Data Integrity: Implement audit logging (e.g., Laravel Auditing) to track critical user actions and data changes for security and debugging.



- Write Clean, Type-Safe Code: Maintain high standards with strict TypeScript on the frontend and solid object-oriented design patterns on the backend.



What We‚Äôre Looking For



- Laravel Mastery: You are comfortable with Eloquent, Service Classes, Policies, and sophisticated database migrations.



- Modern Frontend Skills: You know React beyond the basics. You understand hooks, state management, and how to create reusable UI components with Tailwind CSS.



- Inertia.js Experience: You understand how Inertia acts as the glue between the server and client, avoiding the complexity of full REST/GraphQL APIs where they aren't needed.



- Production Experience with Queues: You have set up and managed Redis/Horizon in a production environment. You understand how to handle failed jobs, retries, and batching.



- Debugging & Auditing: You don't just fix bugs; you implement systems to catch them. You are familiar with error tracking flows and keeping audit trails for critical business logic.
